title: 1 Chronicles 1:1
content: 1 Adam, Seth, Enosh,

title: 1 Chronicles 1:2
content: 2 Kenan, Mahalalel, Jared,

title: 1 Chronicles 1:3
content: 3 Enoch, Methuselah, Lamech,

title: 1 Chronicles 1:4
content: 4 Noah, Shem, Ham, and Japheth.

title: 1 Chronicles 1:5
content: 5 The sons of Japheth: Gomer, Magog, Madai, Javan, Tubal, Meshech, and Tiras.

title: 1 Chronicles 1:6
content: 6 The sons of Gomer: Ashkenaz, Diphath, and Togarmah.

title: 1 Chronicles 1:7
content: 7 The sons of Javan: Elishah, Tarshish, Kittim, and Rodanim.

title: 1 Chronicles 1:8
content: 8 The sons of Ham: Cush, Mizraim, Put, and Canaan.

title: 1 Chronicles 1:9
content: 9 The sons of Cush: Seba, Havilah, Sabta, Raama, Sabteca. The sons of Raamah: Sheba and Dedan.

title: 1 Chronicles 1:10
content: 10 Cush became the father of Nimrod. He began to be a mighty one in the earth.

title: 1 Chronicles 1:11
content: 11 Mizraim became the father of Ludim, Anamim, Lehabim, Naphtuhim,

title: 1 Chronicles 1:12
content: 12 Pathrusim, Casluhim (where the Philistines came from), and Caphtorim.

title: 1 Chronicles 1:13
content: 13 Canaan became the father of Sidon his firstborn, Heth,

title: 1 Chronicles 1:14
content: 14 the Jebusite, the Amorite, the Girgashite,

title: 1 Chronicles 1:15
content: 15 the Hivite, the Arkite, the Sinite,

title: 1 Chronicles 1:16
content: 16 the Arvadite, the Zemarite, and the Hamathite.

title: 1 Chronicles 1:17
content: 17 The sons of Shem: Elam, Asshur, Arpachshad, Lud, Aram, Uz, Hul, Gether, and Meshech.

title: 1 Chronicles 1:18
content: 18 Arpachshad became the father of Shelah, and Shelah became the father of Eber.

title: 1 Chronicles 1:19
content: 19 To Eber were born two sons: the name of the one was Peleg, for in his days the earth was divided; and his brother’s name was Joktan.

title: 1 Chronicles 1:20
content: 20 Joktan became the father of Almodad, Sheleph, Hazarmaveth, Jerah,

title: 1 Chronicles 1:21
content: 21 Hadoram, Uzal, Diklah,

title: 1 Chronicles 1:22
content: 22 Ebal, Abimael, Sheba,

title: 1 Chronicles 1:23
content: 23 Ophir, Havilah, and Jobab. All these were the sons of Joktan.

title: 1 Chronicles 1:24
content: 24 Shem, Arpachshad, Shelah,

title: 1 Chronicles 1:25
content: 25 Eber, Peleg, Reu,

title: 1 Chronicles 1:26
content: 26 Serug, Nahor, Terah,

title: 1 Chronicles 1:27
content: 27 Abram (also called Abraham).

title: 1 Chronicles 1:28
content: 28 The sons of Abraham: Isaac and Ishmael.

title: 1 Chronicles 1:29
content: 29 These are their generations: the firstborn of Ishmael, Nebaioth; then Kedar, Adbeel, Mibsam,

title: 1 Chronicles 1:30
content: 30 Mishma, Dumah, Massa, Hadad, Tema,

title: 1 Chronicles 1:31
content: 31 Jetur, Naphish, and Kedemah. These are the sons of Ishmael.

title: 1 Chronicles 1:32
content: 32 The sons of Keturah, Abraham’s concubine: she bore Zimran, Jokshan, Medan, Midian, Ishbak, and Shuah. The sons of Jokshan: Sheba and Dedan.

title: 1 Chronicles 1:33
content: 33 The sons of Midian: Ephah, Epher, Hanoch, Abida, and Eldaah. All these were the sons of Keturah.

title: 1 Chronicles 1:34
content: 34 Abraham became the father of Isaac. The sons of Isaac: Esau and Israel.

title: 1 Chronicles 1:35
content: 35 The sons of Esau: Eliphaz, Reuel, Jeush, Jalam, and Korah.

title: 1 Chronicles 1:36
content: 36 The sons of Eliphaz: Teman, Omar, Zephi, Gatam, Kenaz, Timna, and Amalek.

title: 1 Chronicles 1:37
content: 37 The sons of Reuel: Nahath, Zerah, Shammah, and Mizzah.

title: 1 Chronicles 1:38
content: 38 The sons of Seir: Lotan, Shobal, Zibeon, Anah, Dishon, Ezer, and Dishan.

title: 1 Chronicles 1:39
content: 39 The sons of Lotan: Hori and Homam; and Timna was Lotan’s sister.

title: 1 Chronicles 1:40
content: 40 The sons of Shobal: Alian, Manahath, Ebal, Shephi, and Onam. The sons of Zibeon: Aiah and Anah.

title: 1 Chronicles 1:41
content: 41 The son of Anah: Dishon. The sons of Dishon: Hamran, Eshban, Ithran, and Cheran.

title: 1 Chronicles 1:42
content: 42 The sons of Ezer: Bilhan, Zaavan, and Jaakan. The sons of Dishan: Uz and Aran.

title: 1 Chronicles 1:43
content: 43 Now these are the kings who reigned in the land of Edom, before any king reigned over the children of Israel: Bela the son of Beor; and the name of his city was Dinhabah.

title: 1 Chronicles 1:44
content: 44 Bela died, and Jobab the son of Zerah of Bozrah reigned in his place.

title: 1 Chronicles 1:45
content: 45 Jobab died, and Husham of the land of the Temanites reigned in his place.

title: 1 Chronicles 1:46
content: 46 Husham died, and Hadad the son of Bedad, who struck Midian in the field of Moab, reigned in his place; and the name of his city was Avith.

title: 1 Chronicles 1:47
content: 47 Hadad died, and Samlah of Masrekah reigned in his place.

title: 1 Chronicles 1:48
content: 48 Samlah died, and Shaul of Rehoboth by the River reigned in his place.

title: 1 Chronicles 1:49
content: 49 Shaul died, and Baal Hanan the son of Achbor reigned in his place.

title: 1 Chronicles 1:50
content: 50 Baal Hanan died, and Hadad reigned in his place; and the name of his city was Pai. His wife’s name was Mehetabel, the daughter of Matred, the daughter of Mezahab.

title: 1 Chronicles 1:51
content: 51 Then Hadad died. The chiefs of Edom were: chief Timna, chief Aliah, chief Jetheth,

title: 1 Chronicles 1:52
content: 52 chief Oholibamah, chief Elah, chief Pinon,

title: 1 Chronicles 1:53
content: 53 chief Kenaz, chief Teman, chief Mibzar,

title: 1 Chronicles 1:54
content: 54 chief Magdiel, and chief Iram. These are the chiefs of Edom.

title: 1 Chronicles 2:1
content: 1 These are the sons of Israel: Reuben, Simeon, Levi, Judah, Issachar, Zebulun,

title: 1 Chronicles 2:2
content: 2 Dan, Joseph, Benjamin, Naphtali, Gad, and Asher.

title: 1 Chronicles 2:3
content: 3 The sons of Judah: Er, Onan, and Shelah, which three were born to him of Shua’s daughter the Canaanitess. Er, Judah’s firstborn, was wicked in the LORD’s sight; and he killed him.

title: 1 Chronicles 2:4
content: 4 Tamar his daughter-in-law bore him Perez and Zerah. All the sons of Judah were five.

title: 1 Chronicles 2:5
content: 5 The sons of Perez: Hezron and Hamul.

title: 1 Chronicles 2:6
content: 6 The sons of Zerah: Zimri, Ethan, Heman, Calcol, and Dara—five of them in all.

title: 1 Chronicles 2:7
content: 7 The son of Carmi: Achar, the troubler of Israel, who committed a trespass in the devoted thing.

title: 1 Chronicles 2:8
content: 8 The son of Ethan: Azariah.

title: 1 Chronicles 2:9
content: 9 The sons also of Hezron, who were born to him: Jerahmeel, Ram, and Chelubai.

title: 1 Chronicles 2:10
content: 10 Ram became the father of Amminadab, and Amminadab became the father of Nahshon, prince of the children of Judah;

title: 1 Chronicles 2:11
content: 11 and Nahshon became the father of Salma, and Salma became the father of Boaz,

title: 1 Chronicles 2:12
content: 12 and Boaz became the father of Obed, and Obed became the father of Jesse;

title: 1 Chronicles 2:13
content: 13 and Jesse became the father of his firstborn Eliab, Abinadab the second, Shimea the third,

title: 1 Chronicles 2:14
content: 14 Nethanel the fourth, Raddai the fifth,

title: 1 Chronicles 2:15
content: 15 Ozem the sixth, and David the seventh;

title: 1 Chronicles 2:16
content: 16 and their sisters were Zeruiah and Abigail. The sons of Zeruiah: Abishai, Joab, and Asahel, three.

title: 1 Chronicles 2:17
content: 17 Abigail bore Amasa; and the father of Amasa was Jether the Ishmaelite.

title: 1 Chronicles 2:18
content: 18 Caleb the son of Hezron became the father of children by Azubah his wife, and by Jerioth; and these were her sons: Jesher, Shobab, and Ardon.

title: 1 Chronicles 2:19
content: 19 Azubah died, and Caleb married Ephrath, who bore him Hur.

title: 1 Chronicles 2:20
content: 20 Hur became the father of Uri, and Uri became the father of Bezalel.

title: 1 Chronicles 2:21
content: 21 Afterward Hezron went in to the daughter of Machir the father of Gilead, whom he took as wife when he was sixty years old; and she bore him Segub.

title: 1 Chronicles 2:22
content: 22 Segub became the father of Jair, who had twenty-three cities in the land of Gilead.

title: 1 Chronicles 2:23
content: 23 Geshur and Aram took the towns of Jair from them, with Kenath, and its villages, even sixty cities. All these were the sons of Machir the father of Gilead.

title: 1 Chronicles 2:24
content: 24 After Hezron died in Caleb Ephrathah, Abijah, Hezron’s wife, bore him Ashhur the father of Tekoa.

title: 1 Chronicles 2:25
content: 25 The sons of Jerahmeel the firstborn of Hezron were Ram the firstborn, Bunah, Oren, Ozem, and Ahijah.

title: 1 Chronicles 2:26
content: 26 Jerahmeel had another wife, whose name was Atarah. She was the mother of Onam.

title: 1 Chronicles 2:27
content: 27 The sons of Ram the firstborn of Jerahmeel were Maaz, Jamin, and Eker.

title: 1 Chronicles 2:28
content: 28 The sons of Onam were Shammai and Jada. The sons of Shammai: Nadab and Abishur.

title: 1 Chronicles 2:29
content: 29 The name of the wife of Abishur was Abihail; and she bore him Ahban and Molid.

title: 1 Chronicles 2:30
content: 30 The sons of Nadab: Seled and Appaim; but Seled died without children.

title: 1 Chronicles 2:31
content: 31 The son of Appaim: Ishi. The son of Ishi: Sheshan. The son of Sheshan: Ahlai.

title: 1 Chronicles 2:32
content: 32 The sons of Jada the brother of Shammai: Jether and Jonathan; and Jether died without children.

title: 1 Chronicles 2:33
content: 33 The sons of Jonathan: Peleth and Zaza. These were the sons of Jerahmeel.

title: 1 Chronicles 2:34
content: 34 Now Sheshan had no sons, but only daughters. Sheshan had a servant, an Egyptian, whose name was Jarha.

title: 1 Chronicles 2:35
content: 35 Sheshan gave his daughter to Jarha his servant as wife; and she bore him Attai.

title: 1 Chronicles 2:36
content: 36 Attai became the father of Nathan, and Nathan became the father of Zabad,

title: 1 Chronicles 2:37
content: 37 and Zabad became the father of Ephlal, and Ephlal became the father of Obed,

title: 1 Chronicles 2:38
content: 38 and Obed became the father of Jehu, and Jehu became the father of Azariah,

title: 1 Chronicles 2:39
content: 39 and Azariah became the father of Helez, and Helez became the father of Eleasah,

title: 1 Chronicles 2:40
content: 40 and Eleasah became the father of Sismai, and Sismai became the father of Shallum,

title: 1 Chronicles 2:41
content: 41 and Shallum became the father of Jekamiah, and Jekamiah became the father of Elishama.

title: 1 Chronicles 2:42
content: 42 The sons of Caleb the brother of Jerahmeel were Mesha his firstborn, who was the father of Ziph, and the sons of Mareshah the father of Hebron.

title: 1 Chronicles 2:43
content: 43 The sons of Hebron: Korah, Tappuah, Rekem, and Shema.

title: 1 Chronicles 2:44
content: 44 Shema became the father of Raham, the father of Jorkeam; and Rekem became the father of Shammai.

title: 1 Chronicles 2:45
content: 45 The son of Shammai was Maon; and Maon was the father of Beth Zur.

title: 1 Chronicles 2:46
content: 46 Ephah, Caleb’s concubine, bore Haran, Moza, and Gazez; and Haran became the father of Gazez.

title: 1 Chronicles 2:47
content: 47 The sons of Jahdai: Regem, Jothan, Geshan, Pelet, Ephah, and Shaaph.

title: 1 Chronicles 2:48
content: 48 Maacah, Caleb’s concubine, bore Sheber and Tirhanah.

title: 1 Chronicles 2:49
content: 49 She bore also Shaaph the father of Madmannah, Sheva the father of Machbena and the father of Gibea; and the daughter of Caleb was Achsah.

title: 1 Chronicles 2:50
content: 50 These were the sons of Caleb, the son of Hur, the firstborn of Ephrathah: Shobal the father of Kiriath Jearim,

title: 1 Chronicles 2:51
content: 51 Salma the father of Bethlehem, and Hareph the father of Beth Gader.

title: 1 Chronicles 2:52
content: 52 Shobal the father of Kiriath Jearim had sons: Haroeh, half of the Menuhoth.

title: 1 Chronicles 2:53
content: 53 The families of Kiriath Jearim: the Ithrites, the Puthites, the Shumathites, and the Mishraites; from them came the Zorathites and the Eshtaolites.

title: 1 Chronicles 2:54
content: 54 The sons of Salma: Bethlehem, the Netophathites, Atroth Beth Joab, and half of the Manahathites, the Zorites.

title: 1 Chronicles 2:55
content: 55 The families of scribes who lived at Jabez: the Tirathites, the Shimeathites, and the Sucathites. These are the Kenites who came from Hammath, the father of the house of Rechab.

title: 1 Chronicles 3:1
content: 1 Now these were the sons of David, who were born to him in Hebron: the firstborn, Amnon, of Ahinoam the Jezreelitess; the second, Daniel, of Abigail the Carmelitess;

title: 1 Chronicles 3:2
content: 2 the third, Absalom the son of Maacah the daughter of Talmai king of Geshur; the fourth, Adonijah the son of Haggith;

title: 1 Chronicles 3:3
content: 3 the fifth, Shephatiah of Abital; the sixth, Ithream by Eglah his wife:

title: 1 Chronicles 3:4
content: 4 six were born to him in Hebron; and he reigned there seven years and six months. He reigned thirty-three years in Jerusalem;

title: 1 Chronicles 3:5
content: 5 and these were born to him in Jerusalem: Shimea, Shobab, Nathan, and Solomon, four, by Bathshua the daughter of Ammiel;

title: 1 Chronicles 3:6
content: 6 and Ibhar, Elishama, Eliphelet,

title: 1 Chronicles 3:7
content: 7 Nogah, Nepheg, Japhia,

title: 1 Chronicles 3:8
content: 8 Elishama, Eliada, and Eliphelet, nine.

title: 1 Chronicles 3:9
content: 9 All these were the sons of David, in addition to the sons of the concubines; and Tamar was their sister.

title: 1 Chronicles 3:10
content: 10 Solomon’s son was Rehoboam, Abijah his son, Asa his son, Jehoshaphat his son,

title: 1 Chronicles 3:11
content: 11 Joram his son, Ahaziah his son, Joash his son,

title: 1 Chronicles 3:12
content: 12 Amaziah his son, Azariah his son, Jotham his son,

title: 1 Chronicles 3:13
content: 13 Ahaz his son, Hezekiah his son, Manasseh his son,

title: 1 Chronicles 3:14
content: 14 Amon his son, and Josiah his son.

title: 1 Chronicles 3:15
content: 15 The sons of Josiah: the firstborn Johanan, the second Jehoiakim, the third Zedekiah, and the fourth Shallum.

title: 1 Chronicles 3:16
content: 16 The sons of Jehoiakim: Jeconiah his son, and Zedekiah his son.

title: 1 Chronicles 3:17
content: 17 The sons of Jeconiah, the captive: Shealtiel his son,

title: 1 Chronicles 3:18
content: 18 Malchiram, Pedaiah, Shenazzar, Jekamiah, Hoshama, and Nedabiah.

title: 1 Chronicles 3:19
content: 19 The sons of Pedaiah: Zerubbabel and Shimei. The sons of Zerubbabel: Meshullam and Hananiah; and Shelomith was their sister;

title: 1 Chronicles 3:20
content: 20 and Hashubah, Ohel, Berechiah, Hasadiah, and Jushab Hesed, five.

title: 1 Chronicles 3:21
content: 21 The sons of Hananiah: Pelatiah and Jeshaiah; the sons of Rephaiah, the sons of Arnan, the sons of Obadiah, the sons of Shecaniah.

title: 1 Chronicles 3:22
content: 22 The son of Shecaniah: Shemaiah. The sons of Shemaiah: Hattush, Igal, Bariah, Neariah, and Shaphat, six.

title: 1 Chronicles 3:23
content: 23 The sons of Neariah: Elioenai, Hizkiah, and Azrikam, three.

title: 1 Chronicles 3:24
content: 24 The sons of Elioenai: Hodaviah, Eliashib, Pelaiah, Akkub, Johanan, Delaiah, and Anani, seven.

title: 1 Chronicles 4:1
content: 1 The sons of Judah: Perez, Hezron, Carmi, Hur, and Shobal.

title: 1 Chronicles 4:2
content: 2 Reaiah the son of Shobal became the father of Jahath; and Jahath became the father of Ahumai and Lahad. These are the families of the Zorathites.

title: 1 Chronicles 4:3
content: 3 These were the sons of the father of Etam: Jezreel, Ishma, and Idbash. The name of their sister was Hazzelelponi.

title: 1 Chronicles 4:4
content: 4 Penuel was the father of Gedor and Ezer the father of Hushah. These are the sons of Hur, the firstborn of Ephrathah, the father of Bethlehem.

title: 1 Chronicles 4:5
content: 5 Ashhur the father of Tekoa had two wives, Helah and Naarah.

title: 1 Chronicles 4:6
content: 6 Naarah bore him Ahuzzam, Hepher, Temeni, and Haahashtari. These were the sons of Naarah.

title: 1 Chronicles 4:7
content: 7 The sons of Helah were Zereth, Izhar, and Ethnan.

title: 1 Chronicles 4:8
content: 8 Hakkoz became the father of Anub, Zobebah, and the families of Aharhel the son of Harum.

title: 1 Chronicles 4:9
content: 9 Jabez was more honorable than his brothers. His mother named him Jabez, saying, “Because I bore him with sorrow.”

title: 1 Chronicles 4:10
content: 10 Jabez called on the God of Israel, saying, “Oh that you would bless me indeed, and enlarge my border! May your hand be with me, and may you keep me from evil, that I may not cause pain!” God granted him that which he requested.

title: 1 Chronicles 4:11
content: 11 Chelub the brother of Shuhah became the father of Mehir, who was the father of Eshton.

title: 1 Chronicles 4:12
content: 12 Eshton became the father of Beth Rapha, Paseah, and Tehinnah the father of Ir Nahash. These are the men of Recah.

title: 1 Chronicles 4:13
content: 13 The sons of Kenaz: Othniel and Seraiah. The sons of Othniel: Hathath.

title: 1 Chronicles 4:14
content: 14 Meonothai became the father of Ophrah: and Seraiah became the father of Joab the father of Ge Harashim, for they were craftsmen.

title: 1 Chronicles 4:15
content: 15 The sons of Caleb the son of Jephunneh: Iru, Elah, and Naam. The son of Elah: Kenaz.

title: 1 Chronicles 4:16
content: 16 The sons of Jehallelel: Ziph, Ziphah, Tiria, and Asarel.

title: 1 Chronicles 4:17
content: 17 The sons of Ezrah: Jether, Mered, Epher, and Jalon; and Mered’s wife bore Miriam, Shammai, and Ishbah the father of Eshtemoa.

title: 1 Chronicles 4:18
content: 18 His wife the Jewess bore Jered the father of Gedor, Heber the father of Soco, and Jekuthiel the father of Zanoah. These are the sons of Bithiah the daughter of Pharaoh, whom Mered took.

title: 1 Chronicles 4:19
content: 19 The sons of the wife of Hodiah, the sister of Naham, were the fathers of Keilah the Garmite and Eshtemoa the Maacathite.

title: 1 Chronicles 4:20
content: 20 The sons of Shimon: Amnon, Rinnah, Ben Hanan, and Tilon. The sons of Ishi: Zoheth, and Ben Zoheth.

title: 1 Chronicles 4:21
content: 21 The sons of Shelah the son of Judah: Er the father of Lecah, Laadah the father of Mareshah, and the families of the house of those who worked fine linen, of the house of Ashbea;

title: 1 Chronicles 4:22
content: 22 and Jokim, and the men of Cozeba, and Joash, and Saraph, who had dominion in Moab, and Jashubilehem. These records are ancient.

title: 1 Chronicles 4:23
content: 23 These were the potters, and the inhabitants of Netaim and Gederah; they lived there with the king for his work.

title: 1 Chronicles 4:24
content: 24 The sons of Simeon: Nemuel, Jamin, Jarib, Zerah, Shaul;

title: 1 Chronicles 4:25
content: 25 Shallum his son, Mibsam his son, and Mishma his son.

title: 1 Chronicles 4:26
content: 26 The sons of Mishma: Hammuel his son, Zaccur his son, Shimei his son.

title: 1 Chronicles 4:27
content: 27 Shimei had sixteen sons and six daughters; but his brothers didn’t have many children, and all their family didn’t multiply like the children of Judah.

title: 1 Chronicles 4:28
content: 28 They lived at Beersheba, Moladah, Hazarshual,

title: 1 Chronicles 4:29
content: 29 at Bilhah, at Ezem, at Tolad,

title: 1 Chronicles 4:30
content: 30 at Bethuel, at Hormah, at Ziklag,

title: 1 Chronicles 4:31
content: 31 at Beth Marcaboth, Hazar Susim, at Beth Biri, and at Shaaraim. These were their cities until David’s reign.

title: 1 Chronicles 4:32
content: 32 Their villages were Etam, Ain, Rimmon, Tochen, and Ashan, five cities;

title: 1 Chronicles 4:33
content: 33 and all their villages that were around the same cities, as far as Baal. These were their settlements, and they kept their genealogy.

title: 1 Chronicles 4:34
content: 34 Meshobab, Jamlech, Joshah the son of Amaziah,

title: 1 Chronicles 4:35
content: 35 Joel, Jehu the son of Joshibiah, the son of Seraiah, the son of Asiel,

title: 1 Chronicles 4:36
content: 36 Elioenai, Jaakobah, Jeshohaiah, Asaiah, Adiel, Jesimiel, Benaiah,

title: 1 Chronicles 4:37
content: 37 and Ziza the son of Shiphi, the son of Allon, the son of Jedaiah, the son of Shimri, the son of Shemaiah—

title: 1 Chronicles 4:38
content: 38 these mentioned by name were princes in their families. Their fathers’ houses increased greatly.

title: 1 Chronicles 4:39
content: 39 They went to the entrance of Gedor, even to the east side of the valley, to seek pasture for their flocks.

title: 1 Chronicles 4:40
content: 40 They found rich, good pasture, and the land was wide, and quiet, and peaceful, for those who lived there before were descended from Ham.

title: 1 Chronicles 4:41
content: 41 These written by name came in the days of Hezekiah king of Judah, and struck their tents and the Meunim who were found there; and they destroyed them utterly to this day, and lived in their place, because there was pasture there for their flocks.

title: 1 Chronicles 4:42
content: 42 Some of them, even of the sons of Simeon, five hundred men, went to Mount Seir, having for their captains Pelatiah, Neariah, Rephaiah, and Uzziel, the sons of Ishi.

title: 1 Chronicles 4:43
content: 43 They struck the remnant of the Amalekites who escaped, and have lived there to this day.

title: 1 Chronicles 5:1
content: 1 The sons of Reuben the firstborn of Israel (for he was the firstborn, but because he defiled his father’s couch, his birthright was given to the sons of Joseph the son of Israel; and the genealogy is not to be listed according to the birthright.

title: 1 Chronicles 5:2
content: 2 For Judah prevailed above his brothers, and from him came the prince; but the birthright was Joseph’s)—

title: 1 Chronicles 5:3
content: 3 the sons of Reuben the firstborn of Israel: Hanoch, Pallu, Hezron, and Carmi.

title: 1 Chronicles 5:4
content: 4 The sons of Joel: Shemaiah his son, Gog his son, Shimei his son,

title: 1 Chronicles 5:5
content: 5 Micah his son, Reaiah his son, Baal his son,

title: 1 Chronicles 5:6
content: 6 and Beerah his son, whom Tilgath Pilneser king of Assyria carried away captive. He was prince of the Reubenites.

title: 1 Chronicles 5:7
content: 7 His brothers by their families, when the genealogy of their generations was listed: the chief, Jeiel, and Zechariah,

title: 1 Chronicles 5:8
content: 8 and Bela the son of Azaz, the son of Shema, the son of Joel, who lived in Aroer, even to Nebo and Baal Meon;

title: 1 Chronicles 5:9
content: 9 and he lived eastward even to the entrance of the wilderness from the river Euphrates, because their livestock were multiplied in the land of Gilead.

title: 1 Chronicles 5:10
content: 10 In the days of Saul, they made war with the Hagrites, who fell by their hand; and they lived in their tents throughout all the land east of Gilead.

title: 1 Chronicles 5:11
content: 11 The sons of Gad lived beside them in the land of Bashan to Salecah:

title: 1 Chronicles 5:12
content: 12 Joel the chief, Shapham the second, Janai, and Shaphat in Bashan.

title: 1 Chronicles 5:13
content: 13 Their brothers of their fathers’ houses: Michael, Meshullam, Sheba, Jorai, Jacan, Zia, and Eber, seven.

title: 1 Chronicles 5:14
content: 14 These were the sons of Abihail, the son of Huri, the son of Jaroah, the son of Gilead, the son of Michael, the son of Jeshishai, the son of Jahdo, the son of Buz;

title: 1 Chronicles 5:15
content: 15 Ahi the son of Abdiel, the son of Guni, chief of their fathers’ houses.

title: 1 Chronicles 5:16
content: 16 They lived in Gilead in Bashan and in its towns, and in all the pasture lands of Sharon as far as their borders.

title: 1 Chronicles 5:17
content: 17 All these were listed by genealogies in the days of Jotham king of Judah, and in the days of Jeroboam king of Israel.

title: 1 Chronicles 5:18
content: 18 The sons of Reuben, the Gadites, and the half-tribe of Manasseh, of valiant men, men able to bear buckler and sword, able to shoot with bow, and skillful in war, were forty-four thousand seven hundred sixty that were able to go out to war.

title: 1 Chronicles 5:19
content: 19 They made war with the Hagrites, with Jetur, and Naphish, and Nodab.

title: 1 Chronicles 5:20
content: 20 They were helped against them, and the Hagrites were delivered into their hand, and all who were with them; for they cried to God in the battle, and he answered them because they put their trust in him.

title: 1 Chronicles 5:21
content: 21 They took away their livestock: of their camels fifty thousand, and of sheep two hundred fifty thousand, and of donkeys two thousand, and of men one hundred thousand.

title: 1 Chronicles 5:22
content: 22 For many fell slain, because the war was of God. They lived in their place until the captivity.

title: 1 Chronicles 5:23
content: 23 The children of the half-tribe of Manasseh lived in the land. They increased from Bashan to Baal Hermon, Senir, and Mount Hermon.

title: 1 Chronicles 5:24
content: 24 These were the heads of their fathers’ houses: Epher, Ishi, Eliel, Azriel, Jeremiah, Hodaviah, and Jahdiel—mighty men of valor, famous men, heads of their fathers’ houses.

title: 1 Chronicles 5:25
content: 25 They trespassed against the God of their fathers, and played the prostitute after the gods of the peoples of the land whom God destroyed before them.

title: 1 Chronicles 5:26
content: 26 So the God of Israel stirred up the spirit of Pul king of Assyria, and the spirit of Tilgath Pilneser king of Assyria, and he carried away the Reubenites, the Gadites, and the half-tribe of Manasseh, and brought them to Halah, Habor, Hara, and to the river of Gozan, to this day.

title: 1 Chronicles 6:1
content: 1 The sons of Levi: Gershon, Kohath, and Merari.

title: 1 Chronicles 6:2
content: 2 The sons of Kohath: Amram, Izhar, Hebron, and Uzziel.

title: 1 Chronicles 6:3
content: 3 The children of Amram: Aaron, Moses, and Miriam. The sons of Aaron: Nadab, Abihu, Eleazar, and Ithamar.

title: 1 Chronicles 6:4
content: 4 Eleazar became the father of Phinehas, Phinehas became the father of Abishua,

title: 1 Chronicles 6:5
content: 5 Abishua became the father of Bukki. Bukki became the father of Uzzi.

title: 1 Chronicles 6:6
content: 6 Uzzi became the father of Zerahiah. Zerahiah became the father of Meraioth.

title: 1 Chronicles 6:7
content: 7 Meraioth became the father of Amariah. Amariah became the father of Ahitub.

title: 1 Chronicles 6:8
content: 8 Ahitub became the father of Zadok. Zadok became the father of Ahimaaz.

title: 1 Chronicles 6:9
content: 9 Ahimaaz became the father of Azariah. Azariah became the father of Johanan.

title: 1 Chronicles 6:10
content: 10 Johanan became the father of Azariah, who executed the priest’s office in the house that Solomon built in Jerusalem.

title: 1 Chronicles 6:11
content: 11 Azariah became the father of Amariah. Amariah became the father of Ahitub.

title: 1 Chronicles 6:12
content: 12 Ahitub became the father of Zadok. Zadok became the father of Shallum.

title: 1 Chronicles 6:13
content: 13 Shallum became the father of Hilkiah. Hilkiah became the father of Azariah.

title: 1 Chronicles 6:14
content: 14 Azariah became the father of Seraiah. Seraiah became the father of Jehozadak.

title: 1 Chronicles 6:15
content: 15 Jehozadak went into captivity when the LORD carried Judah and Jerusalem away by the hand of Nebuchadnezzar.

title: 1 Chronicles 6:16
content: 16 The sons of Levi: Gershom, Kohath, and Merari.

title: 1 Chronicles 6:17
content: 17 These are the names of the sons of Gershom: Libni and Shimei.

title: 1 Chronicles 6:18
content: 18 The sons of Kohath were Amram, Izhar, Hebron, and Uzziel.

title: 1 Chronicles 6:19
content: 19 The sons of Merari: Mahli and Mushi. These are the families of the Levites according to their fathers’ households.

title: 1 Chronicles 6:20
content: 20 Of Gershom: Libni his son, Jahath his son, Zimmah his son,

title: 1 Chronicles 6:21
content: 21 Joah his son, Iddo his son, Zerah his son, and Jeatherai his son.

title: 1 Chronicles 6:22
content: 22 The sons of Kohath: Amminadab his son, Korah his son, Assir his son,

title: 1 Chronicles 6:23
content: 23 Elkanah his son, Ebiasaph his son, Assir his son,

title: 1 Chronicles 6:24
content: 24 Tahath his son, Uriel his son, Uzziah his son, and Shaul his son.

title: 1 Chronicles 6:25
content: 25 The sons of Elkanah: Amasai and Ahimoth.

title: 1 Chronicles 6:26
content: 26 As for Elkanah, the sons of Elkanah: Zophai his son, Nahath his son,

title: 1 Chronicles 6:27
content: 27 Eliab his son, Jeroham his son, and Elkanah his son.

title: 1 Chronicles 6:28
content: 28 The sons of Samuel: the firstborn, Joel, and the second, Abijah.

title: 1 Chronicles 6:29
content: 29 The sons of Merari: Mahli, Libni his son, Shimei his son, Uzzah his son,

title: 1 Chronicles 6:30
content: 30 Shimea his son, Haggiah his son, Asaiah his son.

title: 1 Chronicles 6:31
content: 31 These are they whom David set over the service of song in the LORD’s house after the ark came to rest there.

title: 1 Chronicles 6:32
content: 32 They ministered with song before the tabernacle of the Tent of Meeting until Solomon had built the LORD’s house in Jerusalem. They performed the duties of their office according to their order.

title: 1 Chronicles 6:33
content: 33 These are those who served, and their sons. Of the sons of the Kohathites: Heman the singer, the son of Joel, the son of Samuel,

title: 1 Chronicles 6:34
content: 34 the son of Elkanah, the son of Jeroham, the son of Eliel, the son of Toah,

title: 1 Chronicles 6:35
content: 35 the son of Zuph, the son of Elkanah, the son of Mahath, the son of Amasai,

title: 1 Chronicles 6:36
content: 36 the son of Elkanah, the son of Joel, the son of Azariah, the son of Zephaniah,

title: 1 Chronicles 6:37
content: 37 the son of Tahath, the son of Assir, the son of Ebiasaph, the son of Korah,

title: 1 Chronicles 6:38
content: 38 the son of Izhar, the son of Kohath, the son of Levi, the son of Israel.

title: 1 Chronicles 6:39
content: 39 His brother Asaph, who stood on his right hand, even Asaph the son of Berechiah, the son of Shimea,

title: 1 Chronicles 6:40
content: 40 the son of Michael, the son of Baaseiah, the son of Malchijah,

title: 1 Chronicles 6:41
content: 41 the son of Ethni, the son of Zerah, the son of Adaiah,

title: 1 Chronicles 6:42
content: 42 the son of Ethan, the son of Zimmah, the son of Shimei,

title: 1 Chronicles 6:43
content: 43 the son of Jahath, the son of Gershom, the son of Levi.

title: 1 Chronicles 6:44
content: 44 On the left hand their brothers the sons of Merari: Ethan the son of Kishi, the son of Abdi, the son of Malluch,

title: 1 Chronicles 6:45
content: 45 the son of Hashabiah, the son of Amaziah, the son of Hilkiah,

title: 1 Chronicles 6:46
content: 46 the son of Amzi, the son of Bani, the son of Shemer,

title: 1 Chronicles 6:47
content: 47 the son of Mahli, the son of Mushi, the son of Merari, the son of Levi.

title: 1 Chronicles 6:48
content: 48 Their brothers the Levites were appointed for all the service of the tabernacle of God’s house.

title: 1 Chronicles 6:49
content: 49 But Aaron and his sons offered on the altar of burnt offering, and on the altar of incense, for all the work of the most holy place, and to make atonement for Israel, according to all that Moses the servant of God had commanded.

title: 1 Chronicles 6:50
content: 50 These are the sons of Aaron: Eleazar his son, Phinehas his son, Abishua his son,

title: 1 Chronicles 6:51
content: 51 Bukki his son, Uzzi his son, Zerahiah his son,

title: 1 Chronicles 6:52
content: 52 Meraioth his son, Amariah his son, Ahitub his son,

title: 1 Chronicles 6:53
content: 53 Zadok his son, and Ahimaaz his son.

title: 1 Chronicles 6:54
content: 54 Now these are their dwelling places according to their encampments in their borders: to the sons of Aaron, of the families of the Kohathites (for theirs was the first lot),

title: 1 Chronicles 6:55
content: 55 to them they gave Hebron in the land of Judah, and its pasture lands around it;

title: 1 Chronicles 6:56
content: 56 but the fields of the city and its villages, they gave to Caleb the son of Jephunneh.

title: 1 Chronicles 6:57
content: 57 To the sons of Aaron they gave the cities of refuge, Hebron, Libnah also with its pasture lands, Jattir, Eshtemoa with its pasture lands,

title: 1 Chronicles 6:58
content: 58 Hilen with its pasture lands, Debir with its pasture lands,

title: 1 Chronicles 6:59
content: 59 Ashan with its pasture lands, and Beth Shemesh with its pasture lands;

title: 1 Chronicles 6:60
content: 60 and out of the tribe of Benjamin, Geba with its pasture lands, Allemeth with its pasture lands, and Anathoth with its pasture lands. All their cities throughout their families were thirteen cities.

title: 1 Chronicles 6:61
content: 61 To the rest of the sons of Kohath were given by lot, out of the family of the tribe, out of the half-tribe, the half of Manasseh, ten cities.

title: 1 Chronicles 6:62
content: 62 To the sons of Gershom, according to their families, out of the tribe of Issachar, and out of the tribe of Asher, and out of the tribe of Naphtali, and out of the tribe of Manasseh in Bashan, thirteen cities.

title: 1 Chronicles 6:63
content: 63 To the sons of Merari were given by lot, according to their families, out of the tribe of Reuben, and out of the tribe of Gad, and out of the tribe of Zebulun, twelve cities.

title: 1 Chronicles 6:64
content: 64 The children of Israel gave to the Levites the cities with their pasture lands.

title: 1 Chronicles 6:65
content: 65 They gave by lot out of the tribe of the children of Judah, and out of the tribe of the children of Simeon, and out of the tribe of the children of Benjamin, these cities which are mentioned by name.

title: 1 Chronicles 6:66
content: 66 Some of the families of the sons of Kohath had cities of their borders out of the tribe of Ephraim.

title: 1 Chronicles 6:67
content: 67 They gave to them the cities of refuge, Shechem in the hill country of Ephraim with its pasture lands and Gezer with its pasture lands,

title: 1 Chronicles 6:68
content: 68 Jokmeam with its pasture lands, Beth Horon with its pasture lands,

title: 1 Chronicles 6:69
content: 69 Aijalon with its pasture lands, Gath Rimmon with its pasture lands;

title: 1 Chronicles 6:70
content: 70 and out of the half-tribe of Manasseh, Aner with its pasture lands, and Bileam with its pasture lands, for the rest of the family of the sons of Kohath.

title: 1 Chronicles 6:71
content: 71 To the sons of Gershom were given, out of the family of the half-tribe of Manasseh, Golan in Bashan with its pasture lands, and Ashtaroth with its pasture lands;

title: 1 Chronicles 6:72
content: 72 and out of the tribe of Issachar, Kedesh with its pasture lands, Daberath with its pasture lands,

title: 1 Chronicles 6:73
content: 73 Ramoth with its pasture lands, and Anem with its pasture lands;

title: 1 Chronicles 6:74
content: 74 and out of the tribe of Asher, Mashal with its pasture lands, Abdon with its pasture lands,

title: 1 Chronicles 6:75
content: 75 Hukok with its pasture lands, and Rehob with its pasture lands;

title: 1 Chronicles 6:76
content: 76 and out of the tribe of Naphtali, Kedesh in Galilee with its pasture lands, Hammon with its pasture lands, and Kiriathaim with its pasture lands.

title: 1 Chronicles 6:77
content: 77 To the rest of the Levites, the sons of Merari, were given, out of the tribe of Zebulun, Rimmono with its pasture lands, and Tabor with its pasture lands;

title: 1 Chronicles 6:78
content: 78 and beyond the Jordan at Jericho, on the east side of the Jordan, were given them out of the tribe of Reuben: Bezer in the wilderness with its pasture lands, Jahzah with its pasture lands,

title: 1 Chronicles 6:79
content: 79 Kedemoth with its pasture lands, and Mephaath with its pasture lands;

title: 1 Chronicles 6:80
content: 80 and out of the tribe of Gad, Ramoth in Gilead with its pasture lands, Mahanaim with its pasture lands,

title: 1 Chronicles 6:81
content: 81 Heshbon with its pasture lands, and Jazer with its pasture lands.

title: 1 Chronicles 7:1
content: 1 Of the sons of Issachar: Tola, Puah, Jashub, and Shimron, four.

title: 1 Chronicles 7:2
content: 2 The sons of Tola: Uzzi, Rephaiah, Jeriel, Jahmai, Ibsam, and Shemuel, heads of their fathers’ houses, of Tola; mighty men of valor in their generations. Their number in the days of David was twenty-two thousand six hundred.

title: 1 Chronicles 7:3
content: 3 The son of Uzzi: Izrahiah. The sons of Izrahiah: Michael, Obadiah, Joel, and Isshiah, five; all of them chief men.

title: 1 Chronicles 7:4
content: 4 With them, by their generations, after their fathers’ houses, were bands of the army for war, thirty-six thousand; for they had many wives and sons.

title: 1 Chronicles 7:5
content: 5 Their brothers among all the families of Issachar, mighty men of valor, listed in all by genealogy, were eighty-seven thousand.

title: 1 Chronicles 7:6
content: 6 The sons of Benjamin: Bela, Becher, and Jediael, three.

title: 1 Chronicles 7:7
content: 7 The sons of Bela: Ezbon, Uzzi, Uzziel, Jerimoth, and Iri, five; heads of fathers’ houses, mighty men of valor; and they were listed by genealogy twenty-two thousand thirty-four.

title: 1 Chronicles 7:8
content: 8 The sons of Becher: Zemirah, Joash, Eliezer, Elioenai, Omri, Jeremoth, Abijah, Anathoth, and Alemeth. All these were the sons of Becher.

title: 1 Chronicles 7:9
content: 9 They were listed by genealogy, after their generations, heads of their fathers’ houses, mighty men of valor, twenty thousand two hundred.

title: 1 Chronicles 7:10
content: 10 The son of Jediael: Bilhan. The sons of Bilhan: Jeush, Benjamin, Ehud, Chenaanah, Zethan, Tarshish, and Ahishahar.

title: 1 Chronicles 7:11
content: 11 All these were sons of Jediael, according to the heads of their fathers’ households, mighty men of valor, seventeen thousand two hundred, who were able to go out in the army for war.

title: 1 Chronicles 7:12
content: 12 So were Shuppim, Huppim, the sons of Ir, Hushim, and the sons of Aher.

title: 1 Chronicles 7:13
content: 13 The sons of Naphtali: Jahziel, Guni, Jezer, Shallum, and the sons of Bilhah.

title: 1 Chronicles 7:14
content: 14 The sons of Manasseh: Asriel, whom his concubine the Aramitess bore. She bore Machir the father of Gilead.

title: 1 Chronicles 7:15
content: 15 Machir took a wife of Huppim and Shuppim, whose sister’s name was Maacah. The name of the second was Zelophehad; and Zelophehad had daughters.

title: 1 Chronicles 7:16
content: 16 Maacah the wife of Machir bore a son, and she named him Peresh. The name of his brother was Sheresh; and his sons were Ulam and Rakem.

title: 1 Chronicles 7:17
content: 17 The sons of Ulam: Bedan. These were the sons of Gilead the son of Machir, the son of Manasseh.

title: 1 Chronicles 7:18
content: 18 His sister Hammolecheth bore Ishhod, Abiezer, and Mahlah.

title: 1 Chronicles 7:19
content: 19 The sons of Shemida were Ahian, Shechem, Likhi, and Aniam.

title: 1 Chronicles 7:20
content: 20 The sons of Ephraim: Shuthelah, Bered his son, Tahath his son, Eleadah his son, Tahath his son,

title: 1 Chronicles 7:21
content: 21 Zabad his son, Shuthelah his son, Ezer, and Elead, whom the men of Gath who were born in the land killed, because they came down to take away their livestock.

title: 1 Chronicles 7:22
content: 22 Ephraim their father mourned many days, and his brothers came to comfort him.

title: 1 Chronicles 7:23
content: 23 He went in to his wife, and she conceived and bore a son, and he named him Beriah, because there was trouble with his house.

title: 1 Chronicles 7:24
content: 24 His daughter was Sheerah, who built Beth Horon the lower and the upper, and Uzzen Sheerah.

title: 1 Chronicles 7:25
content: 25 Rephah was his son, Resheph his son, Telah his son, Tahan his son,

title: 1 Chronicles 7:26
content: 26 Ladan his son, Ammihud his son, Elishama his son,

title: 1 Chronicles 7:27
content: 27 Nun his son, and Joshua his son.

title: 1 Chronicles 7:28
content: 28 Their possessions and settlements were Bethel and its towns, and eastward Naaran, and westward Gezer with its towns; Shechem also and its towns, to Azzah and its towns;

title: 1 Chronicles 7:29
content: 29 and by the borders of the children of Manasseh, Beth Shean and its towns, Taanach and its towns, Megiddo and its towns, and Dor and its towns. The children of Joseph the son of Israel lived in these.

title: 1 Chronicles 7:30
content: 30 The sons of Asher: Imnah, Ishvah, Ishvi, and Beriah. Serah was their sister.

title: 1 Chronicles 7:31
content: 31 The sons of Beriah: Heber and Malchiel, who was the father of Birzaith.

title: 1 Chronicles 7:32
content: 32 Heber became the father of Japhlet, Shomer, Hotham, and Shua their sister.

title: 1 Chronicles 7:33
content: 33 The sons of Japhlet: Pasach, Bimhal, and Ashvath. These are the children of Japhlet.

title: 1 Chronicles 7:34
content: 34 The sons of Shemer: Ahi, Rohgah, Jehubbah, and Aram.

title: 1 Chronicles 7:35
content: 35 The sons of Helem his brother: Zophah, Imna, Shelesh, and Amal.

title: 1 Chronicles 7:36
content: 36 The sons of Zophah: Suah, Harnepher, Shual, Beri, Imrah,

title: 1 Chronicles 7:37
content: 37 Bezer, Hod, Shamma, Shilshah, Ithran, and Beera.

title: 1 Chronicles 7:38
content: 38 The sons of Jether: Jephunneh, Pispa, and Ara.

title: 1 Chronicles 7:39
content: 39 The sons of Ulla: Arah, Hanniel, and Rizia.

title: 1 Chronicles 7:40
content: 40 All these were the children of Asher, heads of the fathers’ houses, choice and mighty men of valor, chief of the princes. The number of them listed by genealogy for service in war was twenty-six thousand men.

title: 1 Chronicles 8:1
content: 1 Benjamin became the father of Bela his firstborn, Ashbel the second, Aharah the third,

title: 1 Chronicles 8:2
content: 2 Nohah the fourth, and Rapha the fifth.

title: 1 Chronicles 8:3
content: 3 Bela had sons: Addar, Gera, Abihud,

title: 1 Chronicles 8:4
content: 4 Abishua, Naaman, Ahoah,

title: 1 Chronicles 8:5
content: 5 Gera, Shephuphan, and Huram.

title: 1 Chronicles 8:6
content: 6 These are the sons of Ehud. These are the heads of fathers’ households of the inhabitants of Geba, who were carried captive to Manahath:

title: 1 Chronicles 8:7
content: 7 Naaman, Ahijah, and Gera, who carried them captive; and he became the father of Uzza and Ahihud.

title: 1 Chronicles 8:8
content: 8 Shaharaim became the father of children in the field of Moab, after he had sent them away. Hushim and Baara were his wives.

title: 1 Chronicles 8:9
content: 9 By Hodesh his wife, he became the father of Jobab, Zibia, Mesha, Malcam,

title: 1 Chronicles 8:10
content: 10 Jeuz, Shachia, and Mirmah. These were his sons, heads of fathers’ households.

title: 1 Chronicles 8:11
content: 11 By Hushim, he became the father of Abitub and Elpaal.

title: 1 Chronicles 8:12
content: 12 The sons of Elpaal: Eber, Misham, and Shemed, who built Ono and Lod, with its towns;

title: 1 Chronicles 8:13
content: 13 and Beriah and Shema, who were heads of fathers’ households of the inhabitants of Aijalon, who put to flight the inhabitants of Gath;

title: 1 Chronicles 8:14
content: 14 and Ahio, Shashak, Jeremoth,

title: 1 Chronicles 8:15
content: 15 Zebadiah, Arad, Eder,

title: 1 Chronicles 8:16
content: 16 Michael, Ishpah, Joha, the sons of Beriah,

title: 1 Chronicles 8:17
content: 17 Zebadiah, Meshullam, Hizki, Heber,

title: 1 Chronicles 8:18
content: 18 Ishmerai, Izliah, Jobab, the sons of Elpaal,

title: 1 Chronicles 8:19
content: 19 Jakim, Zichri, Zabdi,

title: 1 Chronicles 8:20
content: 20 Elienai, Zillethai, Eliel,

title: 1 Chronicles 8:21
content: 21 Adaiah, Beraiah, Shimrath, the sons of Shimei,

title: 1 Chronicles 8:22
content: 22 Ishpan, Eber, Eliel,

title: 1 Chronicles 8:23
content: 23 Abdon, Zichri, Hanan,

title: 1 Chronicles 8:24
content: 24 Hananiah, Elam, Anthothijah,

title: 1 Chronicles 8:25
content: 25 Iphdeiah, Penuel, the sons of Shashak,

title: 1 Chronicles 8:26
content: 26 Shamsherai, Shehariah, Athaliah,

title: 1 Chronicles 8:27
content: 27 Jaareshiah, Elijah, Zichri, and the sons of Jeroham.

title: 1 Chronicles 8:28
content: 28 These were heads of fathers’ households throughout their generations, chief men. These lived in Jerusalem.

title: 1 Chronicles 8:29
content: 29 The father of Gibeon, whose wife’s name was Maacah, lived in Gibeon

title: 1 Chronicles 8:30
content: 30 with his firstborn son Abdon, Zur, Kish, Baal, Nadab,

title: 1 Chronicles 8:31
content: 31 Gedor, Ahio, Zecher,

title: 1 Chronicles 8:32
content: 32 and Mikloth, who became the father of Shimeah. They also lived with their families in Jerusalem, near their relatives.

title: 1 Chronicles 8:33
content: 33 Ner became the father of Kish. Kish became the father of Saul. Saul became the father of Jonathan, Malchishua, Abinadab, and Eshbaal.

title: 1 Chronicles 8:34
content: 34 The son of Jonathan was Merib-baal. Merib-baal became the father of Micah.

title: 1 Chronicles 8:35
content: 35 The sons of Micah: Pithon, Melech, Tarea, and Ahaz.

title: 1 Chronicles 8:36
content: 36 Ahaz became the father of Jehoaddah. Jehoaddah became the father of Alemeth, Azmaveth, and Zimri. Zimri became the father of Moza.

title: 1 Chronicles 8:37
content: 37 Moza became the father of Binea. Raphah was his son, Eleasah his son, and Azel his son.

title: 1 Chronicles 8:38
content: 38 Azel had six sons, whose names are these: Azrikam, Bocheru, Ishmael, Sheariah, Obadiah, and Hanan. All these were the sons of Azel.

title: 1 Chronicles 8:39
content: 39 The sons of Eshek his brother: Ulam his firstborn, Jeush the second, and Eliphelet the third.

title: 1 Chronicles 8:40
content: 40 The sons of Ulam were mighty men of valor, archers, and had many sons, and grandsons, one hundred fifty. All these were of the sons of Benjamin.

title: 1 Chronicles 9:1
content: 1 So all Israel were listed by genealogies; and behold, they are written in the book of the kings of Israel. Judah was carried away captive to Babylon for their disobedience.

title: 1 Chronicles 9:2
content: 2 Now the first inhabitants who lived in their possessions in their cities were Israel, the priests, the Levites, and the temple servants.

title: 1 Chronicles 9:3
content: 3 In Jerusalem, there lived of the children of Judah, of the children of Benjamin, and of the children of Ephraim and Manasseh:

title: 1 Chronicles 9:4
content: 4 Uthai the son of Ammihud, the son of Omri, the son of Imri, the son of Bani, of the children of Perez the son of Judah.

title: 1 Chronicles 9:5
content: 5 Of the Shilonites: Asaiah the firstborn and his sons.

title: 1 Chronicles 9:6
content: 6 Of the sons of Zerah: Jeuel and their brothers, six hundred ninety.

title: 1 Chronicles 9:7
content: 7 Of the sons of Benjamin: Sallu the son of Meshullam, the son of Hodaviah, the son of Hassenuah;

title: 1 Chronicles 9:8
content: 8 and Ibneiah the son of Jeroham, and Elah the son of Uzzi, the son of Michri; and Meshullam the son of Shephatiah, the son of Reuel, the son of Ibnijah;

title: 1 Chronicles 9:9
content: 9 and their brothers, according to their generations, nine hundred fifty-six. All these men were heads of fathers’ households by their fathers’ houses.

title: 1 Chronicles 9:10
content: 10 Of the priests: Jedaiah, Jehoiarib, Jachin,

title: 1 Chronicles 9:11
content: 11 and Azariah the son of Hilkiah, the son of Meshullam, the son of Zadok, the son of Meraioth, the son of Ahitub, the ruler of God’s house;

title: 1 Chronicles 9:12
content: 12 and Adaiah the son of Jeroham, the son of Pashhur, the son of Malchijah; and Maasai the son of Adiel, the son of Jahzerah, the son of Meshullam, the son of Meshillemith, the son of Immer;

title: 1 Chronicles 9:13
content: 13 and their brothers, heads of their fathers’ houses, one thousand seven hundred sixty; they were very able men for the work of the service of God’s house.

title: 1 Chronicles 9:14
content: 14 Of the Levites: Shemaiah the son of Hasshub, the son of Azrikam, the son of Hashabiah, of the sons of Merari;

title: 1 Chronicles 9:15
content: 15 and Bakbakkar, Heresh, Galal, and Mattaniah the son of Mica, the son of Zichri, the son of Asaph,

title: 1 Chronicles 9:16
content: 16 and Obadiah the son of Shemaiah, the son of Galal, the son of Jeduthun; and Berechiah the son of Asa, the son of Elkanah, who lived in the villages of the Netophathites.

title: 1 Chronicles 9:17
content: 17 The gatekeepers: Shallum, Akkub, Talmon, Ahiman, and their brothers (Shallum was the chief),

title: 1 Chronicles 9:18
content: 18 who previously served in the king’s gate eastward. They were the gatekeepers for the camp of the children of Levi.

title: 1 Chronicles 9:19
content: 19 Shallum was the son of Kore, the son of Ebiasaph, the son of Korah, and his brothers, of his father’s house, the Korahites, were over the work of the service, keepers of the thresholds of the tent. Their fathers had been over the LORD’s camp, keepers of the entry.

title: 1 Chronicles 9:20
content: 20 Phinehas the son of Eleazar was ruler over them in time past, and the LORD was with him.

title: 1 Chronicles 9:21
content: 21 Zechariah the son of Meshelemiah was gatekeeper of the door of the Tent of Meeting.

title: 1 Chronicles 9:22
content: 22 All these who were chosen to be gatekeepers in the thresholds were two hundred twelve. These were listed by genealogy in their villages, whom David and Samuel the seer ordained in their office of trust.

title: 1 Chronicles 9:23
content: 23 So they and their children had the oversight of the gates of the LORD’s house, even the house of the tent, as guards.

title: 1 Chronicles 9:24
content: 24 On the four sides were the gatekeepers, toward the east, west, north, and south.

title: 1 Chronicles 9:25
content: 25 Their brothers, in their villages, were to come in every seven days from time to time to be with them,

title: 1 Chronicles 9:26
content: 26 for the four chief gatekeepers, who were Levites, were in an office of trust, and were over the rooms and over the treasuries in God’s house.

title: 1 Chronicles 9:27
content: 27 They stayed around God’s house, because that was their duty; and it was their duty to open it morning by morning.

title: 1 Chronicles 9:28
content: 28 Certain of them were in charge of the vessels of service, for these were brought in by count, and these were taken out by count.

title: 1 Chronicles 9:29
content: 29 Some of them also were appointed over the furniture, and over all the vessels of the sanctuary, over the fine flour, the wine, the oil, the frankincense, and the spices.

title: 1 Chronicles 9:30
content: 30 Some of the sons of the priests prepared the mixing of the spices.

title: 1 Chronicles 9:31
content: 31 Mattithiah, one of the Levites, who was the firstborn of Shallum the Korahite, had the office of trust over the things that were baked in pans.

title: 1 Chronicles 9:32
content: 32 Some of their brothers, of the sons of the Kohathites, were over the show bread, to prepare it every Sabbath.

title: 1 Chronicles 9:33
content: 33 These are the singers, heads of fathers’ households of the Levites, who lived in the rooms and were free from other service, for they were employed in their work day and night.

title: 1 Chronicles 9:34
content: 34 These were heads of fathers’ households of the Levites, throughout their generations, chief men. They lived at Jerusalem.

title: 1 Chronicles 9:35
content: 35 Jeiel the father of Gibeon, whose wife’s name was Maacah, lived in Gibeon.

title: 1 Chronicles 9:36
content: 36 His firstborn son was Abdon, then Zur, Kish, Baal, Ner, Nadab,

title: 1 Chronicles 9:37
content: 37 Gedor, Ahio, Zechariah, and Mikloth.

title: 1 Chronicles 9:38
content: 38 Mikloth became the father of Shimeam. They also lived with their relatives in Jerusalem, near their relatives.

title: 1 Chronicles 9:39
content: 39 Ner became the father of Kish. Kish became the father of Saul. Saul became the father of Jonathan, Malchishua, Abinadab, and Eshbaal.

title: 1 Chronicles 9:40
content: 40 The son of Jonathan was Merib-baal. Merib-baal became the father of Micah.

title: 1 Chronicles 9:41
content: 41 The sons of Micah: Pithon, Melech, Tahrea, and Ahaz.

title: 1 Chronicles 9:42
content: 42 Ahaz became the father of Jarah. Jarah became the father of Alemeth, Azmaveth, and Zimri. Zimri became the father of Moza.

title: 1 Chronicles 9:43
content: 43 Moza became the father of Binea, Rephaiah his son, Eleasah his son, and Azel his son.

title: 1 Chronicles 9:44
content: 44 Azel had six sons, whose names are Azrikam, Bocheru, Ishmael, Sheariah, Obadiah, and Hanan. These were the sons of Azel.

title: 1 Chronicles 10:1
content: 1 Now the Philistines fought against Israel; and the men of Israel fled from before the Philistines, and fell down slain on Mount Gilboa.

title: 1 Chronicles 10:2
content: 2 The Philistines followed hard after Saul and after his sons; and the Philistines killed Jonathan, Abinadab, and Malchishua, the sons of Saul.

title: 1 Chronicles 10:3
content: 3 The battle went hard against Saul, and the archers overtook him; and he was distressed by reason of the archers.

title: 1 Chronicles 10:4
content: 4 Then Saul said to his armor bearer, “Draw your sword, and thrust me through with it, lest these uncircumcised come and abuse me.” But his armor bearer would not, for he was terrified. Therefore Saul took his sword and fell on it.

title: 1 Chronicles 10:5
content: 5 When his armor bearer saw that Saul was dead, he likewise fell on his sword and died.

title: 1 Chronicles 10:6
content: 6 So Saul died with his three sons; and all his house died together.

title: 1 Chronicles 10:7
content: 7 When all the men of Israel who were in the valley saw that they fled, and that Saul and his sons were dead, they abandoned their cities, and fled; and the Philistines came and lived in them.

title: 1 Chronicles 10:8
content: 8 On the next day, when the Philistines came to strip the slain, they found Saul and his sons fallen on Mount Gilboa.

title: 1 Chronicles 10:9
content: 9 They stripped him and took his head and his armor, then sent into the land of the Philistines all around to carry the news to their idols and to the people.

title: 1 Chronicles 10:10
content: 10 They put his armor in the house of their gods, and fastened his head in the house of Dagon.

title: 1 Chronicles 10:11
content: 11 When all Jabesh Gilead heard all that the Philistines had done to Saul,

title: 1 Chronicles 10:12
content: 12 all the valiant men arose and took away the body of Saul and the bodies of his sons, and brought them to Jabesh, and buried their bones under the oak in Jabesh, and fasted seven days.

title: 1 Chronicles 10:13
content: 13 So Saul died for his trespass which he committed against the LORD, because of the LORD’s word, which he didn’t keep, and also because he asked counsel of one who had a familiar spirit, to inquire,

title: 1 Chronicles 10:14
content: 14 and didn’t inquire of the LORD. Therefore he killed him, and turned the kingdom over to David the son of Jesse.

title: 1 Chronicles 11:1
content: 1 Then all Israel gathered themselves to David to Hebron, saying, “Behold, we are your bone and your flesh.

title: 1 Chronicles 11:2
content: 2 In times past, even when Saul was king, it was you who led out and brought in Israel. The LORD your God said to you, ‘You shall be shepherd of my people Israel, and you shall be prince over my people Israel.’”

title: 1 Chronicles 11:3
content: 3 So all the elders of Israel came to the king to Hebron; and David made a covenant with them in Hebron before the LORD. They anointed David king over Israel, according to the LORD’s word by Samuel.

title: 1 Chronicles 11:4
content: 4 David and all Israel went to Jerusalem (also called Jebus); and the Jebusites, the inhabitants of the land, were there.

title: 1 Chronicles 11:5
content: 5 The inhabitants of Jebus said to David, “You will not come in here!” Nevertheless David took the stronghold of Zion. The same is David’s city.

title: 1 Chronicles 11:6
content: 6 David had said, “Whoever strikes the Jebusites first shall be chief and captain.” Joab the son of Zeruiah went up first, and was made chief.

title: 1 Chronicles 11:7
content: 7 David lived in the stronghold; therefore they called it David’s city.

title: 1 Chronicles 11:8
content: 8 He built the city all around, from Millo even around; and Joab repaired the rest of the city.

title: 1 Chronicles 11:9
content: 9 David grew greater and greater, for the LORD of Armies was with him.

title: 1 Chronicles 11:10
content: 10 Now these are the chief of the mighty men whom David had, who showed themselves strong with him in his kingdom, together with all Israel, to make him king, according to the LORD’s word concerning Israel.

title: 1 Chronicles 11:11
content: 11 This is the number of the mighty men whom David had: Jashobeam, the son of a Hachmonite, the chief of the thirty; he lifted up his spear against three hundred and killed them at one time.

title: 1 Chronicles 11:12
content: 12 After him was Eleazar the son of Dodo, the Ahohite, who was one of the three mighty men.

title: 1 Chronicles 11:13
content: 13 He was with David at Pasdammim, and there the Philistines were gathered together to battle, where there was a plot of ground full of barley; and the people fled from before the Philistines.

title: 1 Chronicles 11:14
content: 14 They stood in the middle of the plot, defended it, and killed the Philistines; and the LORD saved them by a great victory.

title: 1 Chronicles 11:15
content: 15 Three of the thirty chief men went down to the rock to David, into the cave of Adullam; and the army of the Philistines were encamped in the valley of Rephaim.

title: 1 Chronicles 11:16
content: 16 David was then in the stronghold, and the garrison of the Philistines was in Bethlehem at that time.

title: 1 Chronicles 11:17
content: 17 David longed, and said, “Oh, that someone would give me water to drink from the well of Bethlehem, which is by the gate!”

title: 1 Chronicles 11:18
content: 18 The three broke through the army of the Philistines, and drew water out of the well of Bethlehem that was by the gate, took it, and brought it to David; but David would not drink any of it, but poured it out to the LORD,

title: 1 Chronicles 11:19
content: 19 and said, “My God forbid me, that I should do this! Shall I drink the blood of these men who have put their lives in jeopardy?” For they risked their lives to bring it. Therefore he would not drink it. The three mighty men did these things.

title: 1 Chronicles 11:20
content: 20 Abishai, the brother of Joab, was chief of the three; for he lifted up his spear against three hundred and killed them, and had a name among the three.

title: 1 Chronicles 11:21
content: 21 Of the three, he was more honorable than the two, and was made their captain; however he wasn’t included in the three.

title: 1 Chronicles 11:22
content: 22 Benaiah the son of Jehoiada, the son of a valiant man of Kabzeel, who had done mighty deeds, killed the two sons of Ariel of Moab. He also went down and killed a lion in the middle of a pit on a snowy day.

title: 1 Chronicles 11:23
content: 23 He killed an Egyptian, a man of great stature, five cubits high. In the Egyptian’s hand was a spear like a weaver’s beam; and he went down to him with a staff, plucked the spear out of the Egyptian’s hand, and killed him with his own spear.

title: 1 Chronicles 11:24
content: 24 Benaiah the son of Jehoiada did these things and had a name among the three mighty men.

title: 1 Chronicles 11:25
content: 25 Behold, he was more honorable than the thirty, but he didn’t attain to the three; and David set him over his guard.

title: 1 Chronicles 11:26
content: 26 The mighty men of the armies also include Asahel the brother of Joab, Elhanan the son of Dodo of Bethlehem,

title: 1 Chronicles 11:27
content: 27 Shammoth the Harorite, Helez the Pelonite,

title: 1 Chronicles 11:28
content: 28 Ira the son of Ikkesh the Tekoite, Abiezer the Anathothite,

title: 1 Chronicles 11:29
content: 29 Sibbecai the Hushathite, Ilai the Ahohite,

title: 1 Chronicles 11:30
content: 30 Maharai the Netophathite, Heled the son of Baanah the Netophathite,

title: 1 Chronicles 11:31
content: 31 Ithai the son of Ribai of Gibeah of the children of Benjamin, Benaiah the Pirathonite,

title: 1 Chronicles 11:32
content: 32 Hurai of the brooks of Gaash, Abiel the Arbathite,

title: 1 Chronicles 11:33
content: 33 Azmaveth the Baharumite, Eliahba the Shaalbonite,

title: 1 Chronicles 11:34
content: 34 the sons of Hashem the Gizonite, Jonathan the son of Shagee the Hararite,

title: 1 Chronicles 11:35
content: 35 Ahiam the son of Sacar the Hararite, Eliphal the son of Ur,

title: 1 Chronicles 11:36
content: 36 Hepher the Mecherathite, Ahijah the Pelonite,

title: 1 Chronicles 11:37
content: 37 Hezro the Carmelite, Naarai the son of Ezbai,

title: 1 Chronicles 11:38
content: 38 Joel the brother of Nathan, Mibhar the son of Hagri,

title: 1 Chronicles 11:39
content: 39 Zelek the Ammonite, Naharai the Berothite (the armor bearer of Joab the son of Zeruiah),

title: 1 Chronicles 11:40
content: 40 Ira the Ithrite, Gareb the Ithrite,

title: 1 Chronicles 11:41
content: 41 Uriah the Hittite, Zabad the son of Ahlai,

title: 1 Chronicles 11:42
content: 42 Adina the son of Shiza the Reubenite (a chief of the Reubenites), and thirty with him,

title: 1 Chronicles 11:43
content: 43 Hanan the son of Maacah, Joshaphat the Mithnite,

title: 1 Chronicles 11:44
content: 44 Uzzia the Ashterathite, Shama and Jeiel the sons of Hotham the Aroerite,

title: 1 Chronicles 11:45
content: 45 Jediael the son of Shimri, and Joha his brother, the Tizite,

title: 1 Chronicles 11:46
content: 46 Eliel the Mahavite, and Jeribai, and Joshaviah, the sons of Elnaam, and Ithmah the Moabite,

title: 1 Chronicles 11:47
content: 47 Eliel, Obed, and Jaasiel the Mezobaite.

title: 1 Chronicles 12:1
content: 1 Now these are those who came to David to Ziklag while he was a fugitive from Saul the son of Kish. They were among the mighty men, his helpers in war.

title: 1 Chronicles 12:2
content: 2 They were armed with bows, and could use both the right hand and the left in slinging stones and in shooting arrows from the bow. They were of Saul’s relatives of the tribe of Benjamin.

title: 1 Chronicles 12:3
content: 3 The chief was Ahiezer, then Joash, the sons of Shemaah the Gibeathite; Jeziel and Pelet, the sons of Azmaveth; Beracah; Jehu the Anathothite;

title: 1 Chronicles 12:4
content: 4 Ishmaiah the Gibeonite, a mighty man among the thirty and a leader of the thirty; Jeremiah; Jahaziel; Johanan; Jozabad the Gederathite;

title: 1 Chronicles 12:5
content: 5 Eluzai; Jerimoth; Bealiah; Shemariah; Shephatiah the Haruphite;

title: 1 Chronicles 12:6
content: 6 Elkanah, Isshiah, Azarel, Joezer, and Jashobeam, the Korahites;

title: 1 Chronicles 12:7
content: 7 and Joelah and Zebadiah, the sons of Jeroham of Gedor.

title: 1 Chronicles 12:8
content: 8 Some Gadites joined David in the stronghold in the wilderness, mighty men of valor, men trained for war, who could handle shield and spear; whose faces were like the faces of lions, and they were as swift as the gazelles on the mountains:

title: 1 Chronicles 12:9
content: 9 Ezer the chief, Obadiah the second, Eliab the third,

title: 1 Chronicles 12:10
content: 10 Mishmannah the fourth, Jeremiah the fifth,

title: 1 Chronicles 12:11
content: 11 Attai the sixth, Eliel the seventh,

title: 1 Chronicles 12:12
content: 12 Johanan the eighth, Elzabad the ninth,

title: 1 Chronicles 12:13
content: 13 Jeremiah the tenth, and Machbannai the eleventh.

title: 1 Chronicles 12:14
content: 14 These of the sons of Gad were captains of the army. He who was least was equal to one hundred, and the greatest to one thousand.

title: 1 Chronicles 12:15
content: 15 These are those who went over the Jordan in the first month, when it had overflowed all its banks; and they put to flight all who lived in the valleys, both toward the east and toward the west.

title: 1 Chronicles 12:16
content: 16 Some of the children of Benjamin and Judah came to the stronghold to David.

title: 1 Chronicles 12:17
content: 17 David went out to meet them, and answered them, “If you have come peaceably to me to help me, my heart will be united with you; but if you have come to betray me to my adversaries, since there is no wrong in my hands, may the God of our fathers see this and rebuke it.”

title: 1 Chronicles 12:18
content: 18 Then the Spirit came on Amasai, who was chief of the thirty, and he said, “We are yours, David, and on your side, you son of Jesse. Peace, peace be to you, and peace be to your helpers; for your God helps you.” Then David received them and made them captains of the band.

title: 1 Chronicles 12:19
content: 19 Some of Manasseh also joined David when he came with the Philistines against Saul to battle, but they didn’t help them, for the lords of the Philistines sent him away after consultation, saying, “He will desert to his master Saul to the jeopardy of our heads.”

title: 1 Chronicles 12:20
content: 20 As he went to Ziklag, some from Manasseh joined him: Adnah, Jozabad, Jediael, Michael, Jozabad, Elihu, and Zillethai, captains of thousands who were of Manasseh.

title: 1 Chronicles 12:21
content: 21 They helped David against the band of raiders, for they were all mighty men of valor and were captains in the army.

title: 1 Chronicles 12:22
content: 22 For from day to day men came to David to help him, until there was a great army, like God’s army.

title: 1 Chronicles 12:23
content: 23 These are the numbers of the heads of those who were armed for war, who came to David to Hebron to turn the kingdom of Saul to him, according to the LORD’s word.

title: 1 Chronicles 12:24
content: 24 The children of Judah who bore shield and spear were six thousand eight hundred, armed for war.

title: 1 Chronicles 12:25
content: 25 Of the children of Simeon, mighty men of valor for the war: seven thousand one hundred.

title: 1 Chronicles 12:26
content: 26 Of the children of Levi: four thousand six hundred.

title: 1 Chronicles 12:27
content: 27 Jehoiada was the leader of the household of Aaron; and with him were three thousand seven hundred,

title: 1 Chronicles 12:28
content: 28 and Zadok, a young man mighty of valor, and of his father’s house twenty-two captains.

title: 1 Chronicles 12:29
content: 29 Of the children of Benjamin, Saul’s relatives: three thousand, for until then, the greatest part of them had kept their allegiance to Saul’s house.

title: 1 Chronicles 12:30
content: 30 Of the children of Ephraim: twenty thousand eight hundred, mighty men of valor, famous men in their fathers’ houses.

title: 1 Chronicles 12:31
content: 31 Of the half-tribe of Manasseh: eighteen thousand, who were mentioned by name, to come and make David king.

title: 1 Chronicles 12:32
content: 32 Of the children of Issachar, men who had understanding of the times, to know what Israel ought to do, their heads were two hundred; and all their brothers were at their command.

title: 1 Chronicles 12:33
content: 33 Of Zebulun, such as were able to go out in the army, who could set the battle in array with all kinds of instruments of war: fifty thousand who could command and were not of double heart.

title: 1 Chronicles 12:34
content: 34 Of Naphtali: one thousand captains, and with them with shield and spear thirty-seven thousand.

title: 1 Chronicles 12:35
content: 35 Of the Danites who could set the battle in array: twenty-eight thousand six hundred.

title: 1 Chronicles 12:36
content: 36 Of Asher, such as were able to go out in the army, who could set the battle in array: forty thousand.

title: 1 Chronicles 12:37
content: 37 On the other side of the Jordan, of the Reubenites, the Gadites, and of the half-tribe of Manasseh, with all kinds of instruments of war for the battle: one hundred twenty thousand.

title: 1 Chronicles 12:38
content: 38 All these were men of war who could order the battle array, and came with a perfect heart to Hebron to make David king over all Israel; and all the rest also of Israel were of one heart to make David king.

title: 1 Chronicles 12:39
content: 39 They were there with David three days, eating and drinking; for their brothers had supplied provisions for them.

title: 1 Chronicles 12:40
content: 40 Moreover those who were near to them, as far as Issachar, Zebulun, and Naphtali, brought bread on donkeys, on camels, on mules, and on oxen: supplies of flour, cakes of figs, clusters of raisins, wine, oil, cattle, and sheep in abundance; for there was joy in Israel.

title: 1 Chronicles 13:1
content: 1 David consulted with the captains of thousands and of hundreds, even with every leader.

title: 1 Chronicles 13:2
content: 2 David said to all the assembly of Israel, “If it seems good to you, and if it is of the LORD our God, let’s send word everywhere to our brothers who are left in all the land of Israel, with whom the priests and Levites are in their cities that have pasture lands, that they may gather themselves to us.

title: 1 Chronicles 13:3
content: 3 Also, let’s bring the ark of our God back to us again, for we didn’t seek it in the days of Saul.”

title: 1 Chronicles 13:4
content: 4 All the assembly said that they would do so, for the thing was right in the eyes of all the people.

title: 1 Chronicles 13:5
content: 5 So David assembled all Israel together, from the Shihor River of Egypt even to the entrance of Hamath, to bring God’s ark from Kiriath Jearim.

title: 1 Chronicles 13:6
content: 6 David went up with all Israel to Baalah, that is, to Kiriath Jearim, which belonged to Judah, to bring up from there God the LORD’s ark that sits above the cherubim, that is called by the Name.

title: 1 Chronicles 13:7
content: 7 They carried God’s ark on a new cart, and brought it out of Abinadab’s house; and Uzza and Ahio drove the cart.

title: 1 Chronicles 13:8
content: 8 David and all Israel played before God with all their might, even with songs, with harps, with stringed instruments, with tambourines, with cymbals, and with trumpets.

title: 1 Chronicles 13:9
content: 9 When they came to Chidon’s threshing floor, Uzza put out his hand to hold the ark, for the oxen stumbled.

title: 1 Chronicles 13:10
content: 10 The LORD’s anger burned against Uzza, and he struck him because he put his hand on the ark; and he died there before God.

title: 1 Chronicles 13:11
content: 11 David was displeased, because the LORD had broken out against Uzza. He called that place Perez Uzza, to this day.

title: 1 Chronicles 13:12
content: 12 David was afraid of God that day, saying, “How can I bring God’s ark home to me?”

title: 1 Chronicles 13:13
content: 13 So David didn’t move the ark with him into David’s city, but carried it aside into Obed-Edom the Gittite’s house.

title: 1 Chronicles 13:14
content: 14 God’s ark remained with the family of Obed-Edom in his house three months; and the LORD blessed Obed-Edom’s house and all that he had.

title: 1 Chronicles 14:1
content: 1 Hiram king of Tyre sent messengers to David with cedar trees, masons, and carpenters, to build him a house.

title: 1 Chronicles 14:2
content: 2 David perceived that the LORD had established him king over Israel, for his kingdom was highly exalted, for his people Israel’s sake.

title: 1 Chronicles 14:3
content: 3 David took more wives in Jerusalem, and David became the father of more sons and daughters.

title: 1 Chronicles 14:4
content: 4 These are the names of the children whom he had in Jerusalem: Shammua, Shobab, Nathan, Solomon,

title: 1 Chronicles 14:5
content: 5 Ibhar, Elishua, Elpelet,

title: 1 Chronicles 14:6
content: 6 Nogah, Nepheg, Japhia,

title: 1 Chronicles 14:7
content: 7 Elishama, Beeliada, and Eliphelet.

title: 1 Chronicles 14:8
content: 8 When the Philistines heard that David was anointed king over all Israel, all the Philistines went up to seek David; and David heard of it, and went out against them.

title: 1 Chronicles 14:9
content: 9 Now the Philistines had come and made a raid in the valley of Rephaim.

title: 1 Chronicles 14:10
content: 10 David inquired of God, saying, “Shall I go up against the Philistines? Will you deliver them into my hand?” The LORD said to him, “Go up; for I will deliver them into your hand.”

title: 1 Chronicles 14:11
content: 11 So they came up to Baal Perazim, and David defeated them there. David said, God has broken my enemies by my hand, like waters breaking out. Therefore they called the name of that place Baal Perazim.

title: 1 Chronicles 14:12
content: 12 They left their gods there; and David gave a command, and they were burned with fire.

title: 1 Chronicles 14:13
content: 13 The Philistines made another raid in the valley.

title: 1 Chronicles 14:14
content: 14 David inquired again of God; and God said to him, “You shall not go up after them. Turn away from them, and come on them opposite the mulberry trees.

title: 1 Chronicles 14:15
content: 15 When you hear the sound of marching in the tops of the mulberry trees, then go out to battle; for God has gone out before you to strike the army of the Philistines.”

title: 1 Chronicles 14:16
content: 16 David did as God commanded him; and they attacked the army of the Philistines from Gibeon even to Gezer.

title: 1 Chronicles 14:17
content: 17 The fame of David went out into all lands; and the LORD brought the fear of him on all nations.

title: 1 Chronicles 15:1
content: 1 David made himself houses in David’s city; and he prepared a place for God’s ark, and pitched a tent for it.

title: 1 Chronicles 15:2
content: 2 Then David said, “No one ought to carry God’s ark but the Levites. For the LORD has chosen them to carry God’s ark, and to minister to him forever.”

title: 1 Chronicles 15:3
content: 3 David assembled all Israel at Jerusalem, to bring up the LORD’s ark to its place, which he had prepared for it.

title: 1 Chronicles 15:4
content: 4 David gathered together the sons of Aaron and the Levites:

title: 1 Chronicles 15:5
content: 5 of the sons of Kohath, Uriel the chief, and his brothers one hundred twenty;

title: 1 Chronicles 15:6
content: 6 of the sons of Merari, Asaiah the chief, and his brothers two hundred twenty;

title: 1 Chronicles 15:7
content: 7 of the sons of Gershom, Joel the chief, and his brothers one hundred thirty;

title: 1 Chronicles 15:8
content: 8 of the sons of Elizaphan, Shemaiah the chief, and his brothers two hundred;

title: 1 Chronicles 15:9
content: 9 of the sons of Hebron, Eliel the chief, and his brothers eighty;

title: 1 Chronicles 15:10
content: 10 of the sons of Uzziel, Amminadab the chief, and his brothers one hundred twelve.

title: 1 Chronicles 15:11
content: 11 David called for Zadok and Abiathar the priests, and for the Levites: for Uriel, Asaiah, Joel, Shemaiah, Eliel, and Amminadab,

title: 1 Chronicles 15:12
content: 12 and said to them, “You are the heads of the fathers’ households of the Levites. Sanctify yourselves, both you and your brothers, that you may bring the ark of the LORD, the God of Israel, up to the place that I have prepared for it.

title: 1 Chronicles 15:13
content: 13 For because you didn’t carry it at first, the LORD our God broke out in anger against us, because we didn’t seek him according to the ordinance.”

title: 1 Chronicles 15:14
content: 14 So the priests and the Levites sanctified themselves to bring up the ark of the LORD, the God of Israel.

title: 1 Chronicles 15:15
content: 15 The children of the Levites bore God’s ark on their shoulders with its poles, as Moses commanded according to the LORD’s word.

title: 1 Chronicles 15:16
content: 16 David spoke to the chief of the Levites to appoint their brothers as singers with instruments of music, stringed instruments, harps, and cymbals, sounding aloud and lifting up their voices with joy.

title: 1 Chronicles 15:17
content: 17 So the Levites appointed Heman the son of Joel; and of his brothers, Asaph the son of Berechiah; and of the sons of Merari their brothers, Ethan the son of Kushaiah;

title: 1 Chronicles 15:18
content: 18 and with them their brothers of the second rank: Zechariah, Ben, Jaaziel, Shemiramoth, Jehiel, Unni, Eliab, Benaiah, Maaseiah, Mattithiah, Eliphelehu, Mikneiah, Obed-Edom, and Jeiel, the doorkeepers.

title: 1 Chronicles 15:19
content: 19 So the singers, Heman, Asaph, and Ethan, were given cymbals of bronze to sound aloud;

title: 1 Chronicles 15:20
content: 20 and Zechariah, Aziel, Shemiramoth, Jehiel, Unni, Eliab, Maaseiah, and Benaiah, with stringed instruments set to Alamoth;

title: 1 Chronicles 15:21
content: 21 and Mattithiah, Eliphelehu, Mikneiah, Obed-Edom, Jeiel, and Azaziah, with harps tuned to the eight-stringed lyre, to lead.

title: 1 Chronicles 15:22
content: 22 Chenaniah, chief of the Levites, was over the singing. He taught the singers, because he was skillful.

title: 1 Chronicles 15:23
content: 23 Berechiah and Elkanah were doorkeepers for the ark.

title: 1 Chronicles 15:24
content: 24 Shebaniah, Joshaphat, Nethanel, Amasai, Zechariah, Benaiah, and Eliezer, the priests, blew the trumpets before God’s ark; and Obed-Edom and Jehiah were doorkeepers for the ark.

title: 1 Chronicles 15:25
content: 25 So David, the elders of Israel, and the captains over thousands went to bring the ark of the LORD’s covenant up out of the house of Obed-Edom with joy.

title: 1 Chronicles 15:26
content: 26 When God helped the Levites who bore the ark of the LORD’s covenant, they sacrificed seven bulls and seven rams.

title: 1 Chronicles 15:27
content: 27 David was clothed with a robe of fine linen, as were all the Levites who bore the ark, the singers, and Chenaniah the choir master with the singers; and David had an ephod of linen on him.

title: 1 Chronicles 15:28
content: 28 Thus all Israel brought the ark of the LORD’s covenant up with shouting, with sound of the cornet, with trumpets, and with cymbals, sounding aloud with stringed instruments and harps.

title: 1 Chronicles 15:29
content: 29 As the ark of the LORD’s covenant came to David’s city, Michal the daughter of Saul looked out at the window, and saw king David dancing and playing; and she despised him in her heart.

title: 1 Chronicles 16:1
content: 1 They brought in God’s ark, and set it in the middle of the tent that David had pitched for it; and they offered burnt offerings and peace offerings before God.

title: 1 Chronicles 16:2
content: 2 When David had finished offering the burnt offering and the peace offerings, he blessed the people in the LORD’s name.

title: 1 Chronicles 16:3
content: 3 He gave to everyone of Israel, both man and woman, to everyone a loaf of bread, a portion of meat, and a cake of raisins.

title: 1 Chronicles 16:4
content: 4 He appointed some of the Levites to minister before the LORD’s ark, and to commemorate, to thank, and to praise the LORD, the God of Israel:

title: 1 Chronicles 16:5
content: 5 Asaph the chief, and second to him Zechariah, then Jeiel, Shemiramoth, Jehiel, Mattithiah, Eliab, Benaiah, Obed-Edom, and Jeiel, with stringed instruments and with harps; and Asaph with cymbals, sounding aloud;

title: 1 Chronicles 16:6
content: 6 with Benaiah and Jahaziel the priests with trumpets continually, before the ark of the covenant of God.

title: 1 Chronicles 16:7
content: 7 Then on that day David first ordained giving of thanks to the LORD by the hand of Asaph and his brothers.

title: 1 Chronicles 16:8
content: 8 Oh give thanks to the LORD. Call on his name. Make what he has done known among the peoples.

title: 1 Chronicles 16:9
