content: 9 Sing to him. Sing praises to him. Tell of all his marvelous works.

title: 1 Chronicles 16:10
content: 10 Glory in his holy name. Let the heart of those who seek the LORD rejoice.

title: 1 Chronicles 16:11
content: 11 Seek the LORD and his strength. Seek his face forever more.

title: 1 Chronicles 16:12
content: 12 Remember his marvelous works that he has done, his wonders, and the judgments of his mouth,

title: 1 Chronicles 16:13
content: 13 you offspring of Israel his servant, you children of Jacob, his chosen ones.

title: 1 Chronicles 16:14
content: 14 He is the LORD our God. His judgments are in all the earth.

title: 1 Chronicles 16:15
content: 15 Remember his covenant forever, the word which he commanded to a thousand generations,

title: 1 Chronicles 16:16
content: 16 the covenant which he made with Abraham, his oath to Isaac.

title: 1 Chronicles 16:17
content: 17 He confirmed it to Jacob for a statute, and to Israel for an everlasting covenant,

title: 1 Chronicles 16:18
content: 18 saying, “I will give you the land of Canaan, The lot of your inheritance,”

title: 1 Chronicles 16:19
content: 19 when you were but a few men in number, yes, very few, and foreigners in it.

title: 1 Chronicles 16:20
content: 20 They went about from nation to nation, from one kingdom to another people.

title: 1 Chronicles 16:21
content: 21 He allowed no man to do them wrong. Yes, he reproved kings for their sakes,

title: 1 Chronicles 16:22
content: 22 “Don’t touch my anointed ones! Do my prophets no harm!”

title: 1 Chronicles 16:23
content: 23 Sing to the LORD, all the earth! Display his salvation from day to day.

title: 1 Chronicles 16:24
content: 24 Declare his glory among the nations, and his marvelous works among all the peoples.

title: 1 Chronicles 16:25
content: 25 For great is the LORD, and greatly to be praised. He also is to be feared above all gods.

title: 1 Chronicles 16:26
content: 26 For all the gods of the peoples are idols, but the LORD made the heavens.

title: 1 Chronicles 16:27
content: 27 Honor and majesty are before him. Strength and gladness are in his place.

title: 1 Chronicles 16:28
content: 28 Ascribe to the LORD, you families of the peoples, ascribe to the LORD glory and strength!

title: 1 Chronicles 16:29
content: 29 Ascribe to the LORD the glory due to his name. Bring an offering, and come before him. Worship the LORD in holy array.

title: 1 Chronicles 16:30
content: 30 Tremble before him, all the earth. The world also is established that it can’t be moved.

title: 1 Chronicles 16:31
content: 31 Let the heavens be glad, and let the earth rejoice! Let them say among the nations, “The LORD reigns!”

title: 1 Chronicles 16:32
content: 32 Let the sea roar, and its fullness! Let the field exult, and all that is in it!

title: 1 Chronicles 16:33
content: 33 Then the trees of the forest will sing for joy before the LORD, for he comes to judge the earth.

title: 1 Chronicles 16:34
content: 34 Oh give thanks to the LORD, for he is good, for his loving kindness endures forever.

title: 1 Chronicles 16:35
content: 35 Say, “Save us, God of our salvation! Gather us together and deliver us from the nations, to give thanks to your holy name, to triumph in your praise.”

title: 1 Chronicles 16:36
content: 36 Blessed be the LORD, the God of Israel, from everlasting even to everlasting. All the people said, “Amen,” and praised the LORD.

title: 1 Chronicles 16:37
content: 37 So he left Asaph and his brothers there before the ark of the LORD’s covenant, to minister before the ark continually, as every day’s work required;

title: 1 Chronicles 16:38
content: 38 and Obed-Edom with their sixty-eight relatives; Obed-Edom also the son of Jeduthun and Hosah to be doorkeepers;

title: 1 Chronicles 16:39
content: 39 and Zadok the priest and his brothers the priests, before the LORD’s tabernacle in the high place that was at Gibeon,

title: 1 Chronicles 16:40
content: 40 to offer burnt offerings to the LORD on the altar of burnt offering continually morning and evening, even according to all that is written in the LORD’s law, which he commanded to Israel;

title: 1 Chronicles 16:41
content: 41 and with them Heman and Jeduthun and the rest who were chosen, who were mentioned by name, to give thanks to the LORD, because his loving kindness endures forever;

title: 1 Chronicles 16:42
content: 42 and with them Heman and Jeduthun with trumpets and cymbals for those that should sound aloud, and with instruments for the songs of God, and the sons of Jeduthun to be at the gate.

title: 1 Chronicles 16:43
content: 43 All the people departed, each man to his house; and David returned to bless his house.

title: 1 Chronicles 17:1
content: 1 When David was living in his house, David said to Nathan the prophet, “Behold, I live in a cedar house, but the ark of the LORD’s covenant is in a tent.”

title: 1 Chronicles 17:2
content: 2 Nathan said to David, “Do all that is in your heart; for God is with you.”

title: 1 Chronicles 17:3
content: 3 That same night, the word of God came to Nathan, saying,

title: 1 Chronicles 17:4
content: 4 “Go and tell David my servant, ‘The LORD says, “You shall not build me a house to dwell in;

title: 1 Chronicles 17:5
content: 5 for I have not lived in a house since the day that I brought up Israel to this day, but have gone from tent to tent, and from one tent to another.

title: 1 Chronicles 17:6
content: 6 In all places in which I have walked with all Israel, did I speak a word with any of the judges of Israel, whom I commanded to be shepherd of my people, saying, ‘Why have you not built me a house of cedar?’”’

title: 1 Chronicles 17:7
content: 7 “Now therefore, you shall tell my servant David, ‘The LORD of Armies says, “I took you from the sheep pen, from following the sheep, to be prince over my people Israel.

title: 1 Chronicles 17:8
content: 8 I have been with you wherever you have gone, and have cut off all your enemies from before you. I will make you a name like the name of the great ones who are in the earth.

title: 1 Chronicles 17:9
content: 9 I will appoint a place for my people Israel, and will plant them, that they may dwell in their own place, and be moved no more. The children of wickedness will not waste them any more, as at the first,

title: 1 Chronicles 17:10
content: 10 and from the day that I commanded judges to be over my people Israel. I will subdue all your enemies. Moreover I tell you that the LORD will build you a house.

title: 1 Chronicles 17:11
content: 11 It will happen, when your days are fulfilled that you must go to be with your fathers, that I will set up your offspring after you, who will be of your sons; and I will establish his kingdom.

title: 1 Chronicles 17:12
content: 12 He will build me a house, and I will establish his throne forever.

title: 1 Chronicles 17:13
content: 13 I will be his father, and he will be my son. I will not take my loving kindness away from him, as I took it from him who was before you;

title: 1 Chronicles 17:14
content: 14 but I will settle him in my house and in my kingdom forever. His throne will be established forever.”’”

title: 1 Chronicles 17:15
content: 15 According to all these words, and according to all this vision, so Nathan spoke to David.

title: 1 Chronicles 17:16
content: 16 Then David the king went in and sat before the LORD; and he said, “Who am I, LORD God, and what is my house, that you have brought me this far?

title: 1 Chronicles 17:17
content: 17 This was a small thing in your eyes, O God, but you have spoken of your servant’s house for a great while to come, and have respected me according to the standard of a man of high degree, LORD God.

title: 1 Chronicles 17:18
content: 18 What can David say yet more to you concerning the honor which is done to your servant? For you know your servant.

title: 1 Chronicles 17:19
content: 19 LORD, for your servant’s sake, and according to your own heart, you have done all this greatness, to make known all these great things.

title: 1 Chronicles 17:20
content: 20 LORD, there is no one like you, neither is there any God besides you, according to all that we have heard with our ears.

title: 1 Chronicles 17:21
content: 21 What one nation in the earth is like your people Israel, whom God went to redeem to himself for a people, to make you a name by great and awesome things, in driving out nations from before your people whom you redeemed out of Egypt?

title: 1 Chronicles 17:22
content: 22 For you made your people Israel your own people forever; and you, LORD, became their God.

title: 1 Chronicles 17:23
content: 23 Now, LORD, let the word that you have spoken concerning your servant, and concerning his house, be established forever, and do as you have spoken.

title: 1 Chronicles 17:24
content: 24 Let your name be established and magnified forever, saying, ‘The LORD of Armies is the God of Israel, even a God to Israel. The house of David your servant is established before you.’

title: 1 Chronicles 17:25
content: 25 For you, my God, have revealed to your servant that you will build him a house. Therefore your servant has found courage to pray before you.

title: 1 Chronicles 17:26
content: 26 Now, LORD, you are God, and have promised this good thing to your servant.

title: 1 Chronicles 17:27
content: 27 Now it has pleased you to bless the house of your servant, that it may continue forever before you; for you, LORD, have blessed, and it is blessed forever.”

title: 1 Chronicles 18:1
content: 1 After this, David defeated the Philistines and subdued them, and took Gath and its towns out of the hand of the Philistines.

title: 1 Chronicles 18:2
content: 2 He defeated Moab; and the Moabites became servants to David and brought tribute.

title: 1 Chronicles 18:3
content: 3 David defeated Hadadezer king of Zobah, toward Hamath, as he went to establish his dominion by the river Euphrates.

title: 1 Chronicles 18:4
content: 4 David took from him one thousand chariots, seven thousand horsemen, and twenty thousand footmen; and David hamstrung all the chariot horses, but reserved of them enough for one hundred chariots.

title: 1 Chronicles 18:5
content: 5 When the Syrians of Damascus came to help Hadadezer king of Zobah, David struck twenty-two thousand men of the Syrians.

title: 1 Chronicles 18:6
content: 6 Then David put garrisons in Syria of Damascus; and the Syrians became servants to David and brought tribute. The LORD gave victory to David wherever he went.

title: 1 Chronicles 18:7
content: 7 David took the shields of gold that were on the servants of Hadadezer, and brought them to Jerusalem.

title: 1 Chronicles 18:8
content: 8 From Tibhath and from Cun, cities of Hadadezer, David took very much bronze, with which Solomon made the bronze sea, the pillars, and the vessels of bronze.

title: 1 Chronicles 18:9
content: 9 When Tou king of Hamath heard that David had struck all the army of Hadadezer king of Zobah,

title: 1 Chronicles 18:10
content: 10 he sent Hadoram his son to King David to greet him and to bless him, because he had fought against Hadadezer and struck him (for Hadadezer had wars with Tou); and he had with him all kinds of vessels of gold and silver and bronze.

title: 1 Chronicles 18:11
content: 11 King David also dedicated these to the LORD, with the silver and the gold that he carried away from all the nations: from Edom, from Moab, from the children of Ammon, from the Philistines, and from Amalek.

title: 1 Chronicles 18:12
content: 12 Moreover Abishai the son of Zeruiah struck eighteen thousand of the Edomites in the Valley of Salt.

title: 1 Chronicles 18:13
content: 13 He put garrisons in Edom; and all the Edomites became servants to David. The LORD gave victory to David wherever he went.

title: 1 Chronicles 18:14
content: 14 David reigned over all Israel; and he executed justice and righteousness for all his people.

title: 1 Chronicles 18:15
content: 15 Joab the son of Zeruiah was over the army; Jehoshaphat the son of Ahilud was recorder;

title: 1 Chronicles 18:16
content: 16 Zadok the son of Ahitub and Abimelech the son of Abiathar were priests; Shavsha was scribe;

title: 1 Chronicles 18:17
content: 17 and Benaiah the son of Jehoiada was over the Cherethites and the Pelethites; and the sons of David were chief officials serving the king.

title: 1 Chronicles 19:1
content: 1 After this, Nahash the king of the children of Ammon died, and his son reigned in his place.

title: 1 Chronicles 19:2
content: 2 David said, “I will show kindness to Hanun the son of Nahash, because his father showed kindness to me.” So David sent messengers to comfort him concerning his father. David’s servants came into the land of the children of Ammon to Hanun to comfort him.

title: 1 Chronicles 19:3
content: 3 But the princes of the children of Ammon said to Hanun, “Do you think that David honors your father, in that he has sent comforters to you? Haven’t his servants come to you to search, to overthrow, and to spy out the land?”

title: 1 Chronicles 19:4
content: 4 So Hanun took David’s servants, shaved them, and cut off their garments in the middle at their buttocks, and sent them away.

title: 1 Chronicles 19:5
content: 5 Then some people went and told David how the men were treated. He sent to meet them; for the men were greatly humiliated. The king said, “Stay at Jericho until your beards have grown, and then return.”

title: 1 Chronicles 19:6
content: 6 When the children of Ammon saw that they had made themselves odious to David, Hanun and the children of Ammon sent one thousand talents of silver to hire chariots and horsemen out of Mesopotamia, out of Aram-maacah, and out of Zobah.

title: 1 Chronicles 19:7
content: 7 So they hired for themselves thirty-two thousand chariots, and the king of Maacah with his people, who came and encamped near Medeba. The children of Ammon gathered themselves together from their cities, and came to battle.

title: 1 Chronicles 19:8
content: 8 When David heard of it, he sent Joab with all the army of the mighty men.

title: 1 Chronicles 19:9
content: 9 The children of Ammon came out, and put the battle in array at the gate of the city; and the kings who had come were by themselves in the field.

title: 1 Chronicles 19:10
content: 10 Now when Joab saw that the battle was set against him before and behind, he chose some of all the choice men of Israel, and put them in array against the Syrians.

title: 1 Chronicles 19:11
content: 11 The rest of the people he committed into the hand of Abishai his brother; and they put themselves in array against the children of Ammon.

title: 1 Chronicles 19:12
content: 12 He said, “If the Syrians are too strong for me, then you are to help me; but if the children of Ammon are too strong for you, then I will help you.

title: 1 Chronicles 19:13
content: 13 Be courageous, and let’s be strong for our people and for the cities of our God. May the LORD do that which seems good to him.”

title: 1 Chronicles 19:14
content: 14 So Joab and the people who were with him came near to the front of the Syrians to the battle; and they fled before him.

title: 1 Chronicles 19:15
content: 15 When the children of Ammon saw that the Syrians had fled, they likewise fled before Abishai his brother, and entered into the city. Then Joab came to Jerusalem.

title: 1 Chronicles 19:16
content: 16 When the Syrians saw that they were defeated by Israel, they sent messengers and called out the Syrians who were beyond the River, with Shophach the captain of the army of Hadadezer leading them.

title: 1 Chronicles 19:17
content: 17 David was told that, so he gathered all Israel together, passed over the Jordan, came to them, and set the battle in array against them. So when David had put the battle in array against the Syrians, they fought with him.

title: 1 Chronicles 19:18
content: 18 The Syrians fled before Israel; and David killed of the Syrian men seven thousand charioteers and forty thousand footmen, and also killed Shophach the captain of the army.

title: 1 Chronicles 19:19
content: 19 When the servants of Hadadezer saw that they were defeated by Israel, they made peace with David and served him. The Syrians would not help the children of Ammon any more.

title: 1 Chronicles 20:1
content: 1 At the time of the return of the year, at the time when kings go out, Joab led out the army and wasted the country of the children of Ammon, and came and besieged Rabbah. But David stayed at Jerusalem. Joab struck Rabbah, and overthrew it.

title: 1 Chronicles 20:2
content: 2 David took the crown of their king from off his head, and found it to weigh a talent of gold, and there were precious stones in it. It was set on David’s head, and he brought very much plunder out of the city.

title: 1 Chronicles 20:3
content: 3 He brought out the people who were in it, and had them cut with saws, with iron picks, and with axes. David did so to all the cities of the children of Ammon. Then David and all the people returned to Jerusalem.

title: 1 Chronicles 20:4
content: 4 After this, war arose at Gezer with the Philistines. Then Sibbecai the Hushathite killed Sippai, of the sons of the giant; and they were subdued.

title: 1 Chronicles 20:5
content: 5 Again there was war with the Philistines; and Elhanan the son of Jair killed Lahmi the brother of Goliath the Gittite, the staff of whose spear was like a weaver’s beam.

title: 1 Chronicles 20:6
content: 6 There was again war at Gath, where there was a man of great stature, who had twenty-four fingers and toes, six on each hand and six on each foot; and he also was born to the giant.

title: 1 Chronicles 20:7
content: 7 When he defied Israel, Jonathan the son of Shimea, David’s brother, killed him.

title: 1 Chronicles 20:8
content: 8 These were born to the giant in Gath; and they fell by the hand of David and by the hand of his servants.

title: 1 Chronicles 21:1
content: 1 Satan stood up against Israel, and moved David to take a census of Israel.

title: 1 Chronicles 21:2
content: 2 David said to Joab and to the princes of the people, “Go, count Israel from Beersheba even to Dan; and bring me word, that I may know how many there are.”

title: 1 Chronicles 21:3
content: 3 Joab said, “May the LORD make his people a hundred times as many as they are. But, my lord the king, aren’t they all my lord’s servants? Why does my lord require this thing? Why will he be a cause of guilt to Israel?”

title: 1 Chronicles 21:4
content: 4 Nevertheless the king’s word prevailed against Joab. Therefore Joab departed and went throughout all Israel, then came to Jerusalem.

title: 1 Chronicles 21:5
content: 5 Joab gave the sum of the census of the people to David. All those of Israel were one million one hundred thousand men who drew a sword; and in Judah were four hundred seventy thousand men who drew a sword.

title: 1 Chronicles 21:6
content: 6 But he didn’t count Levi and Benjamin among them, for the king’s word was abominable to Joab.

title: 1 Chronicles 21:7
content: 7 God was displeased with this thing; therefore he struck Israel.

title: 1 Chronicles 21:8
content: 8 David said to God, “I have sinned greatly, in that I have done this thing. But now put away, I beg you, the iniquity of your servant, for I have done very foolishly.”

title: 1 Chronicles 21:9
content: 9 The LORD spoke to Gad, David’s seer, saying,

title: 1 Chronicles 21:10
content: 10 “Go and speak to David, saying, ‘The LORD says, “I offer you three things. Choose one of them, that I may do it to you.”’”

title: 1 Chronicles 21:11
content: 11 So Gad came to David and said to him, “The LORD says, ‘Take your choice:

title: 1 Chronicles 21:12
content: 12 either three years of famine; or three months to be consumed before your foes, while the sword of your enemies overtakes you; or else three days of the sword of the LORD, even pestilence in the land, and the LORD’s angel destroying throughout all the borders of Israel. Now therefore consider what answer I shall return to him who sent me.’”

title: 1 Chronicles 21:13
content: 13 David said to Gad, “I am in distress. Let me fall, I pray, into the LORD’s hand, for his mercies are very great. Don’t let me fall into man’s hand.”

title: 1 Chronicles 21:14
content: 14 So the LORD sent a pestilence on Israel, and seventy thousand men of Israel fell.

title: 1 Chronicles 21:15
content: 15 God sent an angel to Jerusalem to destroy it. As he was about to destroy, the LORD saw, and he relented of the disaster, and said to the destroying angel, “It is enough. Now withdraw your hand.” the LORD’s angel was standing by the threshing floor of Ornan the Jebusite.

title: 1 Chronicles 21:16
content: 16 David lifted up his eyes, and saw the LORD’s angel standing between earth and the sky, having a drawn sword in his hand stretched out over Jerusalem. Then David and the elders, clothed in sackcloth, fell on their faces.

title: 1 Chronicles 21:17
content: 17 David said to God, “Isn’t it I who commanded the people to be counted? It is even I who have sinned and done very wickedly; but these sheep, what have they done? Please let your hand, O LORD my God, be against me and against my father’s house; but not against your people, that they should be plagued.”

title: 1 Chronicles 21:18
content: 18 Then the LORD’s angel commanded Gad to tell David that David should go up and raise an altar to the LORD on the threshing floor of Ornan the Jebusite.

title: 1 Chronicles 21:19
content: 19 David went up at the saying of Gad, which he spoke in the LORD’s name.

title: 1 Chronicles 21:20
content: 20 Ornan turned back and saw the angel; and his four sons who were with him hid themselves. Now Ornan was threshing wheat.

title: 1 Chronicles 21:21
content: 21 As David came to Ornan, Ornan looked and saw David, and went out of the threshing floor, and bowed himself to David with his face to the ground.

title: 1 Chronicles 21:22
content: 22 Then David said to Ornan, “Sell me the place of this threshing floor, that I may build an altar to the LORD on it. You shall sell it to me for the full price, that the plague may be stopped from afflicting the people.”

title: 1 Chronicles 21:23
content: 23 Ornan said to David, “Take it for yourself, and let my lord the king do that which is good in his eyes. Behold, I give the oxen for burnt offerings, and the threshing instruments for wood, and the wheat for the meal offering. I give it all.”

title: 1 Chronicles 21:24
content: 24 King David said to Ornan, “No, but I will most certainly buy it for the full price. For I will not take that which is yours for the LORD, nor offer a burnt offering that costs me nothing.”

title: 1 Chronicles 21:25
content: 25 So David gave to Ornan six hundred shekels of gold by weight for the place.

title: 1 Chronicles 21:26
content: 26 David built an altar to the LORD there, and offered burnt offerings and peace offerings, and called on the LORD; and he answered him from the sky by fire on the altar of burnt offering.

title: 1 Chronicles 21:27
content: 27 Then the LORD commanded the angel, and he put his sword back into its sheath.

title: 1 Chronicles 21:28
content: 28 At that time, when David saw that the LORD had answered him in the threshing floor of Ornan the Jebusite, then he sacrificed there.

title: 1 Chronicles 21:29
content: 29 For the LORD’s tabernacle, which Moses made in the wilderness, and the altar of burnt offering, were at that time in the high place at Gibeon.

title: 1 Chronicles 21:30
content: 30 But David couldn’t go before it to inquire of God, for he was afraid because of the sword of the LORD’s angel.

title: 1 Chronicles 22:1
content: 1 Then David said, “This is the house of the LORD God, and this is the altar of burnt offering for Israel.”

title: 1 Chronicles 22:2
content: 2 David gave orders to gather together the foreigners who were in the land of Israel; and he set masons to cut dressed stones to build God’s house.

title: 1 Chronicles 22:3
content: 3 David prepared iron in abundance for the nails for the doors of the gates and for the couplings, and bronze in abundance without weight,

title: 1 Chronicles 22:4
content: 4 and cedar trees without number, for the Sidonians and the people of Tyre brought cedar trees in abundance to David.

title: 1 Chronicles 22:5
content: 5 David said, “Solomon my son is young and tender, and the house that is to be built for the LORD must be exceedingly magnificent, of fame and of glory throughout all countries. I will therefore make preparation for it.” So David prepared abundantly before his death.

title: 1 Chronicles 22:6
content: 6 Then he called for Solomon his son, and commanded him to build a house for the LORD, the God of Israel.

title: 1 Chronicles 22:7
content: 7 David said to Solomon his son, “As for me, it was in my heart to build a house to the name of the LORD my God.

title: 1 Chronicles 22:8
content: 8 But the LORD’s word came to me, saying, ‘You have shed blood abundantly and have made great wars. You shall not build a house to my name, because you have shed much blood on the earth in my sight.

title: 1 Chronicles 22:9
content: 9 Behold, a son shall be born to you, who shall be a man of peace. I will give him rest from all his enemies all around; for his name shall be Solomon, and I will give peace and quietness to Israel in his days.

title: 1 Chronicles 22:10
content: 10 He shall build a house for my name; and he will be my son, and I will be his father; and I will establish the throne of his kingdom over Israel forever.’

title: 1 Chronicles 22:11
content: 11 Now, my son, may the LORD be with you and prosper you, and build the house of the LORD your God, as he has spoken concerning you.

title: 1 Chronicles 22:12
content: 12 May the LORD give you discretion and understanding, and put you in charge of Israel, so that you may keep the law of the LORD your God.

title: 1 Chronicles 22:13
content: 13 Then you will prosper, if you observe to do the statutes and the ordinances which the LORD gave Moses concerning Israel. Be strong and courageous. Don’t be afraid and don’t be dismayed.

title: 1 Chronicles 22:14
content: 14 Now, behold, in my affliction I have prepared for the LORD’s house one hundred thousand talents of gold, one million talents of silver, and bronze and iron without weight; for it is in abundance. I have also prepared timber and stone; and you may add to them.

title: 1 Chronicles 22:15
content: 15 There are also workmen with you in abundance—cutters and workers of stone and timber, and all kinds of men who are skillful in every kind of work;

title: 1 Chronicles 22:16
content: 16 of the gold, the silver, the bronze, and the iron, there is no number. Arise and be doing, and may the LORD be with you.”

title: 1 Chronicles 22:17
content: 17 David also commanded all the princes of Israel to help Solomon his son, saying,

title: 1 Chronicles 22:18
content: 18 “Isn’t the LORD your God with you? Hasn’t he given you rest on every side? For he has delivered the inhabitants of the land into my hand; and the land is subdued before the LORD and before his people.

title: 1 Chronicles 22:19
content: 19 Now set your heart and your soul to follow the LORD your God. Arise therefore, and build the sanctuary of the LORD God, to bring the ark of the LORD’s covenant and the holy vessels of God into the house that is to be built for the LORD’s name.”

title: 1 Chronicles 23:1
content: 1 Now David was old and full of days; and he made Solomon his son king over Israel.

title: 1 Chronicles 23:2
content: 2 He gathered together all the princes of Israel, with the priests and the Levites.

title: 1 Chronicles 23:3
content: 3 The Levites were counted from thirty years old and upward; and their number by their polls, man by man, was thirty-eight thousand.

title: 1 Chronicles 23:4
content: 4 David said, “Of these, twenty-four thousand were to oversee the work of the LORD’s house, six thousand were officers and judges,

title: 1 Chronicles 23:5
content: 5 four thousand were doorkeepers, and four thousand praised the LORD with the instruments which I made for giving praise.”

title: 1 Chronicles 23:6
content: 6 David divided them into divisions according to the sons of Levi: Gershon, Kohath, and Merari.

title: 1 Chronicles 23:7
content: 7 Of the Gershonites: Ladan and Shimei.

title: 1 Chronicles 23:8
content: 8 The sons of Ladan: Jehiel the chief, Zetham, and Joel, three.

title: 1 Chronicles 23:9
content: 9 The sons of Shimei: Shelomoth, Haziel, and Haran, three. These were the heads of the fathers’ households of Ladan.

title: 1 Chronicles 23:10
content: 10 The sons of Shimei: Jahath, Zina, Jeush, and Beriah. These four were the sons of Shimei.

title: 1 Chronicles 23:11
content: 11 Jahath was the chief, and Zizah the second; but Jeush and Beriah didn’t have many sons; therefore they became a fathers’ house in one reckoning.

title: 1 Chronicles 23:12
content: 12 The sons of Kohath: Amram, Izhar, Hebron, and Uzziel, four.

title: 1 Chronicles 23:13
content: 13 The sons of Amram: Aaron and Moses; and Aaron was separated that he should sanctify the most holy things, he and his sons forever, to burn incense before the LORD, to minister to him, and to bless in his name forever.

title: 1 Chronicles 23:14
content: 14 But as for Moses the man of God, his sons were named among the tribe of Levi.

title: 1 Chronicles 23:15
content: 15 The sons of Moses: Gershom and Eliezer.

title: 1 Chronicles 23:16
content: 16 The sons of Gershom: Shebuel the chief.

title: 1 Chronicles 23:17
content: 17 The son of Eliezer was Rehabiah the chief; and Eliezer had no other sons, but the sons of Rehabiah were very many.

title: 1 Chronicles 23:18
content: 18 The son of Izhar: Shelomith the chief.

title: 1 Chronicles 23:19
content: 19 The sons of Hebron: Jeriah the chief, Amariah the second, Jahaziel the third, and Jekameam the fourth.

title: 1 Chronicles 23:20
content: 20 The sons of Uzziel: Micah the chief, and Isshiah the second.

title: 1 Chronicles 23:21
content: 21 The sons of Merari: Mahli and Mushi. The sons of Mahli: Eleazar and Kish.

title: 1 Chronicles 23:22
content: 22 Eleazar died, and had no sons, but daughters only; and their relatives, the sons of Kish, took them as wives.

title: 1 Chronicles 23:23
content: 23 The sons of Mushi: Mahli, Eder, and Jeremoth, three.

title: 1 Chronicles 23:24
content: 24 These were the sons of Levi after their fathers’ houses, even the heads of the fathers’ houses of those who were counted individually, in the number of names by their polls, who did the work for the service of the LORD’s house, from twenty years old and upward.

title: 1 Chronicles 23:25
content: 25 For David said, “The LORD, the God of Israel, has given rest to his people; and he dwells in Jerusalem forever.

title: 1 Chronicles 23:26
content: 26 Also the Levites will no longer need to carry the tabernacle and all its vessels for its service.”

title: 1 Chronicles 23:27
content: 27 For by the last words of David the sons of Levi were counted, from twenty years old and upward.

title: 1 Chronicles 23:28
content: 28 For their duty was to wait on the sons of Aaron for the service of the LORD’s house—in the courts, in the rooms, and in the purifying of all holy things, even the work of the service of God’s house;

title: 1 Chronicles 23:29
content: 29 for the show bread also, and for the fine flour for a meal offering, whether of unleavened wafers, or of that which is baked in the pan, or of that which is soaked, and for all measurements of quantity and size;

title: 1 Chronicles 23:30
content: 30 and to stand every morning to thank and praise the LORD, and likewise in the evening;

title: 1 Chronicles 23:31
content: 31 and to offer all burnt offerings to the LORD on the Sabbaths, on the new moons, and on the set feasts, in number according to the ordinance concerning them, continually before the LORD;

title: 1 Chronicles 23:32
content: 32 and that they should keep the duty of the Tent of Meeting, the duty of the holy place, and the duty of the sons of Aaron their brothers for the service of the LORD’s house.

title: 1 Chronicles 24:1
content: 1 These were the divisions of the sons of Aaron. The sons of Aaron: Nadab, Abihu, Eleazar, and Ithamar.

title: 1 Chronicles 24:2
content: 2 But Nadab and Abihu died before their father, and had no children; therefore Eleazar and Ithamar served as priests.

title: 1 Chronicles 24:3
content: 3 David, with Zadok of the sons of Eleazar and Ahimelech of the sons of Ithamar, divided them according to their ordering in their service.

title: 1 Chronicles 24:4
content: 4 There were more chief men found of the sons of Eleazar than of the sons of Ithamar; and they were divided like this: of the sons of Eleazar there were sixteen, heads of fathers’ houses; and of the sons of Ithamar, according to their fathers’ houses, eight.

title: 1 Chronicles 24:5
content: 5 Thus they were divided impartially by drawing lots; for there were princes of the sanctuary and princes of God, both of the sons of Eleazar, and of the sons of Ithamar.

title: 1 Chronicles 24:6
content: 6 Shemaiah the son of Nethanel the scribe, who was of the Levites, wrote them in the presence of the king, the princes, Zadok the priest, Ahimelech the son of Abiathar, and the heads of the fathers’ households of the priests and of the Levites; one fathers’ house being taken for Eleazar, and one taken for Ithamar.

title: 1 Chronicles 24:7
content: 7 Now the first lot came out to Jehoiarib, the second to Jedaiah,

title: 1 Chronicles 24:8
content: 8 the third to Harim, the fourth to Seorim,

title: 1 Chronicles 24:9
content: 9 the fifth to Malchijah, the sixth to Mijamin,

title: 1 Chronicles 24:10
content: 10 the seventh to Hakkoz, the eighth to Abijah,

title: 1 Chronicles 24:11
content: 11 the ninth to Jeshua, the tenth to Shecaniah,

title: 1 Chronicles 24:12
content: 12 the eleventh to Eliashib, the twelfth to Jakim,

title: 1 Chronicles 24:13
content: 13 the thirteenth to Huppah, the fourteenth to Jeshebeab,

title: 1 Chronicles 24:14
content: 14 the fifteenth to Bilgah, the sixteenth to Immer,

title: 1 Chronicles 24:15
content: 15 the seventeenth to Hezir, the eighteenth to Happizzez,

title: 1 Chronicles 24:16
content: 16 the nineteenth to Pethahiah, the twentieth to Jehezkel,

title: 1 Chronicles 24:17
content: 17 the twenty-first to Jachin, the twenty-second to Gamul,

title: 1 Chronicles 24:18
content: 18 the twenty-third to Delaiah, and the twenty-fourth to Maaziah.

title: 1 Chronicles 24:19
content: 19 This was their ordering in their service, to come into the LORD’s house according to the ordinance given to them by Aaron their father, as the LORD, the God of Israel, had commanded him.

title: 1 Chronicles 24:20
content: 20 Of the rest of the sons of Levi: of the sons of Amram, Shubael; of the sons of Shubael, Jehdeiah.

title: 1 Chronicles 24:21
content: 21 Of Rehabiah: of the sons of Rehabiah, Isshiah the chief.

title: 1 Chronicles 24:22
content: 22 Of the Izharites, Shelomoth; of the sons of Shelomoth, Jahath.

title: 1 Chronicles 24:23
content: 23 The sons of Hebron: Jeriah, Amariah the second, Jahaziel the third, and Jekameam the fourth.

title: 1 Chronicles 24:24
content: 24 The sons of Uzziel: Micah; of the sons of Micah, Shamir.

title: 1 Chronicles 24:25
content: 25 The brother of Micah: Isshiah; of the sons of Isshiah, Zechariah.

title: 1 Chronicles 24:26
content: 26 The sons of Merari: Mahli and Mushi. The son of Jaaziah: Beno.

title: 1 Chronicles 24:27
content: 27 The sons of Merari by Jaaziah: Beno, Shoham, Zaccur, and Ibri.

title: 1 Chronicles 24:28
content: 28 Of Mahli: Eleazar, who had no sons.

title: 1 Chronicles 24:29
content: 29 Of Kish, the son of Kish: Jerahmeel.

title: 1 Chronicles 24:30
content: 30 The sons of Mushi: Mahli, Eder, and Jerimoth. These were the sons of the Levites after their fathers’ houses.

title: 1 Chronicles 24:31
content: 31 These likewise cast lots even as their brothers the sons of Aaron in the presence of David the king, Zadok, Ahimelech, and the heads of the fathers’ households of the priests and of the Levites, the fathers’ households of the chief even as those of his younger brother.

title: 1 Chronicles 25:1
content: 1 Moreover, David and the captains of the army set apart for the service certain of the sons of Asaph, of Heman, and of Jeduthun, who were to prophesy with harps, with stringed instruments, and with cymbals. The number of those who did the work according to their service was:

title: 1 Chronicles 25:2
content: 2 of the sons of Asaph: Zaccur, Joseph, Nethaniah, and Asharelah. The sons of Asaph were under the hand of Asaph, who prophesied at the order of the king.

title: 1 Chronicles 25:3
content: 3 Of Jeduthun, the sons of Jeduthun: Gedaliah, Zeri, Jeshaiah, Shimei, Hashabiah, and Mattithiah, six, under the hands of their father Jeduthun, who prophesied in giving thanks and praising the LORD with the harp.

title: 1 Chronicles 25:4
content: 4 Of Heman, the sons of Heman: Bukkiah, Mattaniah, Uzziel, Shebuel, Jerimoth, Hananiah, Hanani, Eliathah, Giddalti, Romamti-Ezer, Joshbekashah, Mallothi, Hothir, and Mahazioth.

title: 1 Chronicles 25:5
content: 5 All these were the sons of Heman the king’s seer in the words of God, to lift up the horn. God gave to Heman fourteen sons and three daughters.

title: 1 Chronicles 25:6
content: 6 All these were under the hands of their father for song in the LORD’s house, with cymbals, stringed instruments, and harps, for the service of God’s house: Asaph, Jeduthun, and Heman being under the order of the king.

title: 1 Chronicles 25:7
content: 7 The number of them, with their brothers who were instructed in singing to the LORD, even all who were skillful, was two hundred eighty-eight.

title: 1 Chronicles 25:8
content: 8 They cast lots for their offices, all alike, the small as well as the great, the teacher as well as the student.

title: 1 Chronicles 25:9
content: 9 Now the first lot came out for Asaph to Joseph; the second to Gedaliah, he and his brothers and sons were twelve;

title: 1 Chronicles 25:10
content: 10 the third to Zaccur, his sons and his brothers, twelve;

title: 1 Chronicles 25:11
content: 11 the fourth to Izri, his sons and his brothers, twelve;

title: 1 Chronicles 25:12
content: 12 the fifth to Nethaniah, his sons and his brothers, twelve;

title: 1 Chronicles 25:13
content: 13 the sixth to Bukkiah, his sons and his brothers, twelve;

title: 1 Chronicles 25:14
content: 14 the seventh to Jesharelah, his sons and his brothers, twelve;

title: 1 Chronicles 25:15
content: 15 the eighth to Jeshaiah, his sons and his brothers, twelve;

title: 1 Chronicles 25:16
content: 16 the ninth to Mattaniah, his sons and his brothers, twelve;

title: 1 Chronicles 25:17
content: 17 the tenth to Shimei, his sons and his brothers, twelve;

title: 1 Chronicles 25:18
content: 18 the eleventh to Azarel, his sons and his brothers, twelve;

title: 1 Chronicles 25:19
content: 19 the twelfth to Hashabiah, his sons and his brothers, twelve;

title: 1 Chronicles 25:20
content: 20 for the thirteenth, Shubael, his sons and his brothers, twelve;

title: 1 Chronicles 25:21
content: 21 for the fourteenth, Mattithiah, his sons and his brothers, twelve;

title: 1 Chronicles 25:22
content: 22 for the fifteenth to Jeremoth, his sons and his brothers, twelve;

title: 1 Chronicles 25:23
content: 23 for the sixteenth to Hananiah, his sons and his brothers, twelve;

title: 1 Chronicles 25:24
content: 24 for the seventeenth to Joshbekashah, his sons and his brothers, twelve;

title: 1 Chronicles 25:25
content: 25 for the eighteenth to Hanani, his sons and his brothers, twelve;

title: 1 Chronicles 25:26
content: 26 for the nineteenth to Mallothi, his sons and his brothers, twelve;

title: 1 Chronicles 25:27
content: 27 for the twentieth to Eliathah, his sons and his brothers, twelve;

title: 1 Chronicles 25:28
content: 28 for the twenty-first to Hothir, his sons and his brothers, twelve;

title: 1 Chronicles 25:29
content: 29 for the twenty-second to Giddalti, his sons and his brothers, twelve;

title: 1 Chronicles 25:30
content: 30 for the twenty-third to Mahazioth, his sons and his brothers, twelve;

title: 1 Chronicles 25:31
content: 31 for the twenty-fourth to Romamti-Ezer, his sons and his brothers, twelve.

title: 1 Chronicles 26:1
content: 1 For the divisions of the doorkeepers: of the Korahites, Meshelemiah the son of Kore, of the sons of Asaph.

title: 1 Chronicles 26:2
content: 2 Meshelemiah had sons: Zechariah the firstborn, Jediael the second, Zebadiah the third, Jathniel the fourth,

title: 1 Chronicles 26:3
content: 3 Elam the fifth, Jehohanan the sixth, and Eliehoenai the seventh.

title: 1 Chronicles 26:4
content: 4 Obed-Edom had sons: Shemaiah the firstborn, Jehozabad the second, Joah the third, Sacar the fourth, Nethanel the fifth,

title: 1 Chronicles 26:5
content: 5 Ammiel the sixth, Issachar the seventh, and Peullethai the eighth; for God blessed him.

title: 1 Chronicles 26:6
content: 6 Sons were also born to Shemaiah his son, who ruled over the house of their father; for they were mighty men of valor.

title: 1 Chronicles 26:7
content: 7 The sons of Shemaiah: Othni, Rephael, Obed, and Elzabad, whose relatives were valiant men, Elihu, and Semachiah.

title: 1 Chronicles 26:8
content: 8 All these were of the sons of Obed-Edom with their sons and their brothers, able men in strength for the service: sixty-two of Obed-Edom.

title: 1 Chronicles 26:9
content: 9 Meshelemiah had sons and brothers, eighteen valiant men.

title: 1 Chronicles 26:10
content: 10 Also Hosah, of the children of Merari, had sons: Shimri the chief (for though he was not the firstborn, yet his father made him chief),

title: 1 Chronicles 26:11
content: 11 Hilkiah the second, Tebaliah the third, and Zechariah the fourth. All the sons and brothers of Hosah were thirteen.

title: 1 Chronicles 26:12
content: 12 Of these were the divisions of the doorkeepers, even of the chief men, having offices like their brothers, to minister in the LORD’s house.

title: 1 Chronicles 26:13
content: 13 They cast lots, the small as well as the great, according to their fathers’ houses, for every gate.

title: 1 Chronicles 26:14
content: 14 The lot eastward fell to Shelemiah. Then for Zechariah his son, a wise counselor, they cast lots; and his lot came out northward.

title: 1 Chronicles 26:15
content: 15 To Obed-Edom southward; and to his sons the storehouse.

title: 1 Chronicles 26:16
content: 16 To Shuppim and Hosah westward, by the gate of Shallecheth, at the causeway that goes up, watchman opposite watchman.

title: 1 Chronicles 26:17
content: 17 Eastward were six Levites, northward four a day, southward four a day, and for the storehouse two and two.

title: 1 Chronicles 26:18
content: 18 For Parbar westward, four at the causeway, and two at Parbar.

title: 1 Chronicles 26:19
content: 19 These were the divisions of the doorkeepers; of the sons of the Korahites, and of the sons of Merari.

title: 1 Chronicles 26:20
content: 20 Of the Levites, Ahijah was over the treasures of God’s house and over the treasures of the dedicated things.

title: 1 Chronicles 26:21
content: 21 The sons of Ladan, the sons of the Gershonites belonging to Ladan, the heads of the fathers’ households belonging to Ladan the Gershonite: Jehieli.

title: 1 Chronicles 26:22
content: 22 The sons of Jehieli: Zetham, and Joel his brother, over the treasures of the LORD’s house.

title: 1 Chronicles 26:23
content: 23 Of the Amramites, of the Izharites, of the Hebronites, of the Uzzielites:

title: 1 Chronicles 26:24
content: 24 Shebuel the son of Gershom, the son of Moses, was ruler over the treasuries.

title: 1 Chronicles 26:25
content: 25 His brothers: of Eliezer, Rehabiah his son, and Jeshaiah his son, and Joram his son, and Zichri his son, and Shelomoth his son.

title: 1 Chronicles 26:26
content: 26 This Shelomoth and his brothers were over all the treasuries of the dedicated things, which David the king, and the heads of the fathers’ households, the captains over thousands and hundreds, and the captains of the army, had dedicated.

title: 1 Chronicles 26:27
content: 27 They dedicated some of the plunder won in battles to repair the LORD’s house.

title: 1 Chronicles 26:28
content: 28 All that Samuel the seer, Saul the son of Kish, Abner the son of Ner, and Joab the son of Zeruiah had dedicated, whoever had dedicated anything, it was under the hand of Shelomoth and of his brothers.

title: 1 Chronicles 26:29
content: 29 Of the Izharites, Chenaniah and his sons were appointed to the outward business over Israel, for officers and judges.

title: 1 Chronicles 26:30
content: 30 Of the Hebronites, Hashabiah and his brothers, one thousand seven hundred men of valor, had the oversight of Israel beyond the Jordan westward, for all the business of the LORD and for the service of the king.

title: 1 Chronicles 26:31
content: 31 Of the Hebronites, Jerijah was the chief of the Hebronites, according to their generations by fathers’ households. They were sought for in the fortieth year of the reign of David, and mighty men of valor were found among them at Jazer of Gilead.

title: 1 Chronicles 26:32
content: 32 His relatives, men of valor, were two thousand seven hundred, heads of fathers’ households, whom King David made overseers over the Reubenites, the Gadites, and the half-tribe of the Manassites, for every matter pertaining to God and for the affairs of the king.

title: 1 Chronicles 27:1
content: 1 Now the children of Israel after their number, the heads of fathers’ households and the captains of thousands and of hundreds, and their officers who served the king in any matter of the divisions which came in and went out month by month throughout all the months of the year—of every division were twenty-four thousand.

title: 1 Chronicles 27:2
content: 2 Over the first division for the first month was Jashobeam the son of Zabdiel. In his division were twenty-four thousand.

title: 1 Chronicles 27:3
content: 3 He was of the children of Perez, the chief of all the captains of the army for the first month.

title: 1 Chronicles 27:4
content: 4 Over the division of the second month was Dodai the Ahohite and his division, and Mikloth the ruler; and in his division were twenty-four thousand.

title: 1 Chronicles 27:5
content: 5 The third captain of the army for the third month was Benaiah, the son of Jehoiada the chief priest. In his division were twenty-four thousand.

title: 1 Chronicles 27:6
content: 6 This is that Benaiah who was the mighty man of the thirty and over the thirty. Of his division was Ammizabad his son.

title: 1 Chronicles 27:7
content: 7 The fourth captain for the fourth month was Asahel the brother of Joab, and Zebadiah his son after him. In his division were twenty-four thousand.

title: 1 Chronicles 27:8
content: 8 The fifth captain for the fifth month was Shamhuth the Izrahite. In his division were twenty-four thousand.

title: 1 Chronicles 27:9
content: 9 The sixth captain for the sixth month was Ira the son of Ikkesh the Tekoite. In his division were twenty-four thousand.

title: 1 Chronicles 27:10
content: 10 The seventh captain for the seventh month was Helez the Pelonite, of the children of Ephraim. In his division were twenty-four thousand.

title: 1 Chronicles 27:11
content: 11 The eighth captain for the eighth month was Sibbecai the Hushathite, of the Zerahites. In his division were twenty-four thousand.

title: 1 Chronicles 27:12
content: 12 The ninth captain for the ninth month was Abiezer the Anathothite, of the Benjamites. In his division were twenty-four thousand.

title: 1 Chronicles 27:13
content: 13 The tenth captain for the tenth month was Maharai the Netophathite, of the Zerahites. In his division were twenty-four thousand.

title: 1 Chronicles 27:14
content: 14 The eleventh captain for the eleventh month was Benaiah the Pirathonite, of the children of Ephraim. In his division were twenty-four thousand.

title: 1 Chronicles 27:15
content: 15 The twelfth captain for the twelfth month was Heldai the Netophathite, of Othniel. In his division were twenty-four thousand.

title: 1 Chronicles 27:16
content: 16 Furthermore over the tribes of Israel: of the Reubenites, Eliezer the son of Zichri was the ruler; of the Simeonites, Shephatiah the son of Maacah;

title: 1 Chronicles 27:17
content: 17 of Levi, Hashabiah the son of Kemuel; of Aaron, Zadok;

title: 1 Chronicles 27:18
content: 18 of Judah, Elihu, one of the brothers of David; of Issachar, Omri the son of Michael;

title: 1 Chronicles 27:19
content: 19 of Zebulun, Ishmaiah the son of Obadiah; of Naphtali, Jeremoth the son of Azriel;

title: 1 Chronicles 27:20
content: 20 of the children of Ephraim, Hoshea the son of Azaziah; of the half-tribe of Manasseh, Joel the son of Pedaiah;

title: 1 Chronicles 27:21
content: 21 of the half-tribe of Manasseh in Gilead, Iddo the son of Zechariah; of Benjamin, Jaasiel the son of Abner;

title: 1 Chronicles 27:22
content: 22 of Dan, Azarel the son of Jeroham. These were the captains of the tribes of Israel.

title: 1 Chronicles 27:23
content: 23 But David didn’t take the number of them from twenty years old and under, because the LORD had said he would increase Israel like the stars of the sky.

title: 1 Chronicles 27:24
content: 24 Joab the son of Zeruiah began to take a census, but didn’t finish; and wrath came on Israel for this. The number wasn’t put into the account in the chronicles of King David.

title: 1 Chronicles 27:25
content: 25 Over the king’s treasures was Azmaveth the son of Adiel. Over the treasures in the fields, in the cities, in the villages, and in the towers was Jonathan the son of Uzziah;

title: 1 Chronicles 27:26
content: 26 Over those who did the work of the field for tillage of the ground was Ezri the son of Chelub.

title: 1 Chronicles 27:27
content: 27 Over the vineyards was Shimei the Ramathite. Over the increase of the vineyards for the wine cellars was Zabdi the Shiphmite.

title: 1 Chronicles 27:28
content: 28 Over the olive trees and the sycamore trees that were in the lowland was Baal Hanan the Gederite. Over the cellars of oil was Joash.

title: 1 Chronicles 27:29
content: 29 Over the herds that fed in Sharon was Shitrai the Sharonite. Over the herds that were in the valleys was Shaphat the son of Adlai.

title: 1 Chronicles 27:30
content: 30 Over the camels was Obil the Ishmaelite. Over the donkeys was Jehdeiah the Meronothite. Over the flocks was Jaziz the Hagrite.

title: 1 Chronicles 27:31
content: 31 All these were the rulers of the property which was King David’s.

title: 1 Chronicles 27:32
content: 32 Also Jonathan, David’s uncle, was a counselor, a man of understanding, and a scribe. Jehiel the son of Hachmoni was with the king’s sons.

title: 1 Chronicles 27:33
content: 33 Ahithophel was the king’s counselor. Hushai the Archite was the king’s friend.

title: 1 Chronicles 27:34
content: 34 After Ahithophel was Jehoiada the son of Benaiah, and Abiathar. Joab was the captain of the king’s army.

title: 1 Chronicles 28:1
content: 1 David assembled all the princes of Israel, the princes of the tribes, the captains of the companies who served the king by division, the captains of thousands, the captains of hundreds, and the rulers over all the substance and possessions of the king and of his sons, with the officers and the mighty men, even all the mighty men of valor, to Jerusalem.

title: 1 Chronicles 28:2
content: 2 Then David the king stood up on his feet and said, “Hear me, my brothers and my people! As for me, it was in my heart to build a house of rest for the ark of the LORD’s covenant, and for the footstool of our God; and I had prepared for the building.

title: 1 Chronicles 28:3
content: 3 But God said to me, ‘You shall not build a house for my name, because you are a man of war and have shed blood.’

title: 1 Chronicles 28:4
content: 4 However the LORD, the God of Israel, chose me out of all the house of my father to be king over Israel forever. For he has chosen Judah to be prince; and in the house of Judah, the house of my father; and among the sons of my father he took pleasure in me to make me king over all Israel.

title: 1 Chronicles 28:5
content: 5 Of all my sons (for the LORD has given me many sons), he has chosen Solomon my son to sit on the throne of the LORD’s kingdom over Israel.

title: 1 Chronicles 28:6
content: 6 He said to me, ‘Solomon, your son, shall build my house and my courts; for I have chosen him to be my son, and I will be his father.

title: 1 Chronicles 28:7
content: 7 I will establish his kingdom forever if he continues to do my commandments and my ordinances, as it is today.’

title: 1 Chronicles 28:8
content: 8 Now therefore, in the sight of all Israel, the LORD’s assembly, and in the audience of our God, observe and seek out all the commandments of the LORD your God, that you may possess this good land, and leave it for an inheritance to your children after you forever.

title: 1 Chronicles 28:9
content: 9 You, Solomon my son, know the God of your father, and serve him with a perfect heart and with a willing mind; for the LORD searches all hearts, and understands all the imaginations of the thoughts. If you seek him, he will be found by you; but if you forsake him, he will cast you off forever.

title: 1 Chronicles 28:10
content: 10 Take heed now, for the LORD has chosen you to build a house for the sanctuary. Be strong, and do it.”

title: 1 Chronicles 28:11
content: 11 Then David gave to Solomon his son the plans for the porch of the temple, for its houses, for its treasuries, for its upper rooms, for its inner rooms, for the place of the mercy seat;

title: 1 Chronicles 28:12
content: 12 and the plans of all that he had by the Spirit, for the courts of the LORD’s house, for all the surrounding rooms, for the treasuries of God’s house, and for the treasuries of the dedicated things;

title: 1 Chronicles 28:13
content: 13 also for the divisions of the priests and the Levites, for all the work of the service of the LORD’s house, and for all the vessels of service in the LORD’s house—

title: 1 Chronicles 28:14
content: 14 of gold by weight for the gold for all vessels of every kind of service, for all the vessels of silver by weight, for all vessels of every kind of service;

title: 1 Chronicles 28:15
content: 15 by weight also for the lamp stands of gold, and for its lamps, of gold, by weight for every lamp stand and for its lamps; and for the lamp stands of silver, by weight for every lamp stand and for its lamps, according to the use of every lamp stand;

title: 1 Chronicles 28:16
content: 16 and the gold by weight for the tables of show bread, for every table; and silver for the tables of silver;

title: 1 Chronicles 28:17
content: 17 and the forks, the basins, and the cups, of pure gold; and for the golden bowls by weight for every bowl; and for the silver bowls by weight for every bowl;

title: 1 Chronicles 28:18
content: 18 and for the altar of incense, refined gold by weight; and gold for the plans for the chariot, and the cherubim that spread out and cover the ark of the LORD’s covenant.

title: 1 Chronicles 28:19
content: 19 “All this”, David said, “I have been made to understand in writing from the LORD’s hand, even all the works of this pattern.”

title: 1 Chronicles 28:20
content: 20 David said to Solomon his son, “Be strong and courageous, and do it. Don’t be afraid, nor be dismayed, for the LORD God, even my God, is with you. He will not fail you nor forsake you, until all the work for the service of the LORD’s house is finished.

title: 1 Chronicles 28:21
content: 21 Behold, there are the divisions of the priests and the Levites for all the service of God’s house. Every willing man who has skill for any kind of service shall be with you in all kinds of work. Also the captains and all the people will be entirely at your command.”

title: 1 Chronicles 29:1
content: 1 David the king said to all the assembly, “Solomon my son, whom alone God has chosen, is yet young and tender, and the work is great; for the palace is not for man, but for the LORD God.

title: 1 Chronicles 29:2
content: 2 Now I have prepared with all my might for the house of my God the gold for the things of gold, the silver for the things of silver, the bronze for the things of bronze, iron for the things of iron, and wood for the things of wood, also onyx stones, stones to be set, stones for inlaid work of various colors, all kinds of precious stones, and marble stones in abundance.

title: 1 Chronicles 29:3
content: 3 In addition, because I have set my affection on the house of my God, since I have a treasure of my own of gold and silver, I give it to the house of my God, over and above all that I have prepared for the holy house:

title: 1 Chronicles 29:4
content: 4 even three thousand talents of gold, of the gold of Ophir, and seven thousand talents of refined silver, with which to overlay the walls of the houses;

title: 1 Chronicles 29:5
content: 5 of gold for the things of gold, and of silver for the things of silver, and for all kinds of work to be made by the hands of artisans. Who then offers willingly to consecrate himself today to the LORD?”

title: 1 Chronicles 29:6
content: 6 Then the princes of the fathers’ households, and the princes of the tribes of Israel, and the captains of thousands and of hundreds, with the rulers over the king’s work, offered willingly;

title: 1 Chronicles 29:7
content: 7 and they gave for the service of God’s house of gold five thousand talents and ten thousand darics, of silver ten thousand talents, of bronze eighteen thousand talents, and of iron one hundred thousand talents.

title: 1 Chronicles 29:8
content: 8 People with whom precious stones were found gave them to the treasure of the LORD’s house, under the hand of Jehiel the Gershonite.

title: 1 Chronicles 29:9
content: 9 Then the people rejoiced, because they offered willingly, because with a perfect heart they offered willingly to the LORD; and David the king also rejoiced with great joy.

title: 1 Chronicles 29:10
content: 10 Therefore David blessed the LORD before all the assembly; and David said, “You are blessed, LORD, the God of Israel our father, forever and ever.

title: 1 Chronicles 29:11
content: 11 Yours, LORD, is the greatness, the power, the glory, the victory, and the majesty! For all that is in the heavens and in the earth is yours. Yours is the kingdom, LORD, and you are exalted as head above all.

title: 1 Chronicles 29:12
content: 12 Both riches and honor come from you, and you rule over all! In your hand is power and might! It is in your hand to make great, and to give strength to all!

title: 1 Chronicles 29:13
content: 13 Now therefore, our God, we thank you and praise your glorious name.

title: 1 Chronicles 29:14
content: 14 But who am I, and what is my people, that we should be able to offer so willingly as this? For all things come from you, and we have given you of your own.

title: 1 Chronicles 29:15
content: 15 For we are strangers before you and foreigners, as all our fathers were. Our days on the earth are as a shadow, and there is no remaining.

title: 1 Chronicles 29:16
content: 16 LORD our God, all this store that we have prepared to build you a house for your holy name comes from your hand, and is all your own.

title: 1 Chronicles 29:17
content: 17 I know also, my God, that you try the heart and have pleasure in uprightness. As for me, in the uprightness of my heart I have willingly offered all these things. Now I have seen with joy your people, who are present here, offer willingly to you.

title: 1 Chronicles 29:18
content: 18 LORD, the God of Abraham, of Isaac, and of Israel, our fathers, keep this desire forever in the thoughts of the heart of your people, and prepare their heart for you;

title: 1 Chronicles 29:19
content: 19 and give to Solomon my son a perfect heart, to keep your commandments, your testimonies, and your statutes, and to do all these things, and to build the palace, for which I have made provision.”

title: 1 Chronicles 29:20
content: 20 Then David said to all the assembly, “Now bless the LORD your God!” All the assembly blessed the LORD, the God of their fathers, and bowed down their heads and prostrated themselves before the LORD and the king.

title: 1 Chronicles 29:21
content: 21 They sacrificed sacrifices to the LORD and offered burnt offerings to the LORD on the next day after that day, even one thousand bulls, one thousand rams, and one thousand lambs, with their drink offerings and sacrifices in abundance for all Israel,

title: 1 Chronicles 29:22
content: 22 and ate and drank before the LORD on that day with great gladness. They made Solomon the son of David king the second time, and anointed him before the LORD to be prince, and Zadok to be priest.

title: 1 Chronicles 29:23
content: 23 Then Solomon sat on the throne of the LORD as king instead of David his father, and prospered; and all Israel obeyed him.

title: 1 Chronicles 29:24
content: 24 All the princes, the mighty men, and also all of the sons of King David submitted themselves to Solomon the king.

title: 1 Chronicles 29:25
content: 25 The LORD magnified Solomon exceedingly in the sight of all Israel, and gave to him such royal majesty as had not been on any king before him in Israel.

title: 1 Chronicles 29:26
content: 26 Now David the son of Jesse reigned over all Israel.

title: 1 Chronicles 29:27
content: 27 The time that he reigned over Israel was forty years; he reigned seven years in Hebron, and he reigned thirty-three years in Jerusalem.

title: 1 Chronicles 29:28
content: 28 He died at a good old age, full of days, riches, and honor; and Solomon his son reigned in his place.

title: 1 Chronicles 29:29
content: 29 Now the acts of David the king, first and last, behold, they are written in the history of Samuel the seer, and in the history of Nathan the prophet, and in the history of Gad the seer,

title: 1 Chronicles 29:30
content: 30 with all his reign and his might, and the events that involved him, Israel, and all the kingdoms of the lands.
